text: Giving four stars to China Chili doesn't necessarily mean I think the place is fantastic -- but the spicy garlic eggplant is fantastic, and I'm still pondering its fantasticness hours later. My husband and I also enjoyed the rest of our meal -- yiu-shan chicken and one of the house specialties, black pepper prawns and scallops. Yes, I concur with other reviewers that some of the dishes are not gonna be fantastic. Still, I look upon the place as reliable, clean, moderately priced and efficient. I don't need P.F. Chang's.

The food here is really good. They somehow make green beans and tofu delicious. Miracles never ends.  
Their orange chicken is the best I've ever had (no hint of that nasty ketchup flavor you get a some places) and the sizzling rice soup...there are no words.
Not "special" but if you are a fan of the old school Chinese restaurants, this is a pretty good one. Fast lunches, solid menu, and fair pricing - this place is always busy and for good reason.

Excellent and interesting Chinese food! Its not fancy, but has a nice Asian ambiance,  and is inexpensive for sure. I've only been a handful of times and everything has always been delicious but this last time on New Years Day I had the szechuan prawns. Omg. Amazing!!!! Huge portion and the sauce was spicy tangy sweet and perfect.

Some seriously good and authentic Chinese food in Phoenix, of all places. Mapo tofu is pretty darn spicy and delicious. Their peking duck with steamed buns is perfectly cooked and cut for easy consumption. Plenty of delectable crispy skin. Check this place out, but don't expect any sort of endagered animal express.

Our go-to for Chinese ( which I don't eat often due to high sodium).  Always get the orange chicken with sauce on side to go.  Chicken always good- not overly coated and fried.  Sauce just enough kick.  Owners always friendly and on their game

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because a GIANT fly was flying around our table. We almost think it came out of the kitchen because I swear it appeared when we started serving ourselves. 

China Chili is great! The spicy garlic eggplant is so freaking good. The soup wasn't anything special, but is you order chicken they almost give you the whole chicken! It was more like a whole breast cut up into pieces as opposed to individual pieces breaded and fried and whatnot, so it is obviously more healthy... They give you a TON of food and the price is good. Huge place so you will almost always get a table.
Had a great meal!  The sizzling rice soup was very flavorful. Main course entrees were delicious, as well. The restaurant is very clean and the staff is very friendly. Will be back!

I have been a regular at China Chili for over 10 years. Sadly once they moved to the new location on 3rd Street and Flower their quality has been deteriorating.  

Went recently for lunch and ordered the Mongolian Beef and Beef Foo Young and both were awful, no taste, no flavor and very sub standard.  The prices have gone up the quality is shameful.

I think that the Orange Chicken is possibly their best item right now but sadly did not have it.  Thought I would explore to other dishes but never again.

Not sure I will be back, possibly for lunch for the Orange Chicken. With so many other choices of Asian Food.. this local favorite has not kept up its quality.

Went here today because it was on the way to a destination and near by. I've been trying honey walnut shrimp/prawns at different places to see where I can find a favorite. I was by myself and made a smoothie for my journey so I didn't need a drink and planned to tip well because of it. Definitely got a weird look but I expected that.. The dining room is just a big open room and lots of white linens so it's very bright. The food came in a flash and was delish. The shrimps were huge and the batter was almost perfect, slightly mushy, but I liked it. I always ask for extra sauce to mix with the rice and it was a good amount. I'm kind of a stickler about rice, growing up in a half Japanese household. The rice was the best so far although still kind of dry but I can imagine because it's made in copious amounts. I asked the server for a box because I had about 6 shrimp I couldn't finish. The server brought the box  and offered to pack the food for me :). I declined nicely because it was only a couple shrimp.I asked for the check accidentally assuming he would have brought that too. After ten minutes I think he might have forgot, trying to make eye contact with other servers was difficult as they seemed uber focused on other things or not really wanting to help a solo eater such as myself haha. Eventually I got my bill and due to the tasty food and maybe for them to pay attention to people like me in the future I tipped well and left with a happy tummy. :) I will be back.

I was really craving chinese food today... too bad this place was NOT what I had hoped for. I ordered the orange chicken, fried rice, soup, and crab puffs. The chicken is dry and tasteless (on the menu it said SPICY however it is not spicy or flavorful at all). The rice has no vegetables or anything - it is just flavorless, oil soaked grains. The soup container was LESS THAN HALF FULL and smelled so wretched I couldn't bring myself to taste it. The crab puffs were decent, but not enough to make up for the 15 dollars worth of wasted food. I won't be coming back.

This place gets packed easily, but I manage to be seated quickly. Drinks & Food are served at a fast pace! The food is amazing & really great quality! At the end, I'm very satisfied. I recommend this place to be one of the best Chinese Food around Phoenix.

This is the best Chinese food I've had in the phx area. The restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food was awesome. I'm glad I have finally found a good Chinese food restaurant. I will for sure be going back!

I heard great things about this place from my boyfriend so I had to try it.  I perused their menu and figured I'd try their famous House Special Chicken Lunch Special (included Sweet and Sour soup).  Since I also went there for dinner (serves food family style), I also tried their Orange Chicken, Sizzling Rice Soup (enough for 4 bowls), and a Shrimp dish (the name escapes me now) -- they were all *very* good.

While the House Special Chicken wasn't extremely spicy (for my taste), it was still delicous to me. :9  I wouldn't say their food isn't authentic Chinese, but it was definitely adjusted to make this place unique from all other chinese restaurants I've been to--which gives it a plus in my opinion.  I really liked how their chicken or shrimp dishes were tender and not dry.  Most places cook the chicken until it's overcooked.  They did a great job here.

I really enjoyed it here and highly recommend it for people who are bored of "the usual" :)

My family and I go here all the time. Best place in the valley great Chinese food. Crab puffs are delicious, mongollion beef is awesome and the best lo mien! Defiantly a must try! Service is fast and food is a reasonable price.

I have been to China Chili a half dozen times mostly for lunch with co-workers.  Their food is consistenly good.  Wait staff are not very friendly but make up for it with sheer efficiency and quickness in taking your order and bringing your food. We have never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated without a reservation during crowded lunch times.
The restaurant decor is spacious and inviting reflective of Chinese art/culture; 
Two of my favorite dishes include: The Orange Chicken :  generous breastmeat  not overly breaded with the right amount of heat. Delicious. Spicy Green Beans with Tofu is another excellent dish with green beans not over-cooked and flavorful braised tofu that absobs the garlicky sauce.  I am not a huge fan of Chinese food, prefering instead Thai, Vietnamese and Japanese  cuisine which, for me, has more interesting ingredients.  But CC rates far above the other chinese restaurants I  have tried.

.

Well, after hearing how wonderful this place is, my husband and I decided to give it a try. Our first visit was dine-in.  Food was average and service was pretty bad. Next evening we decided to try their take out. I ordered sweet & sour chicken with the sauce on the side. After picking up my order and beginning the drive home, I realized that the onions, green peppers and pineapple was missing from the chicken container. I went back to the restaurant and was told that the veggies were in the sauce (because I ordered the sauce on the side) to keep them crispy.  I said "great" and left.  When I got home, I opened my container of sweet & sour sauce and found 1 bite size piece of pineapple, 1 bite size piece of onion and 1 bite size piece of bell pepper!!  Won't be back...

This is a great restaurant if you're a fan of Chinese food.  I seem to gravitate around the spicey dishes, like chicken and beef.  On their menu, the spicey dishes have a little red chili pepper next to the dish.  Their soups are very good, too.  I tend to go there for lunch because I work near the state capitol, so I'm not sure what the menu looks like at dinner time.  The prices are very reasonalbe, but if you do go there for lunch, go early!!  The place really fills up, and there is not much off-street parking.  After noon time, there are always people waiting to be seated.

Years ago, this restaurant was located on Central Avenue in a little, tiny brick building painted bright pink in color.  They lost their lease in that former location, and the building was torn down, so they didn't exist for about a year and a half.  Finally, they reopened at their current location at 3rd Street and Flower.  I'm glad they returned!!
This place was awesome! First time here we took my sister in law here before she leaves to China for 3 months. Food was really good! I will be back and highly recommend

I have eaten in restaurant only a handful of times.  The service is friendly but lacking.  Now, I only eat here if it is catered at work and even then if I haven't brought my lunch into the office.  The vegetables are always overcooked, mushy and taste oily.  The chicken is always over done.  The beef is gristly and flavorless.  The sauces on the food, and the ones on the side, are gloppy and thick, often oily and often flavorless.  The egg rolls are small and greasy, maybe they need to drain them more before serving?  
The good parts:  I don't pay for the lunch when it is catered at work, but like I said...I still only eat this if I didn't bring my own lunch for some reason and the fortune cookies!
Best Chinese in Phoenix hands down. The hot and spicy prawns are a must and so are the house chow fun noodles.
EXCELLENT orange chicken with just the right sweet and spice, crispy exterior, and whole breast meat. $9 feeds two humans, or one hungry American.
Food was very good. Not a fan of their Kung Pao Chicken though. Service was fast and friendly and the restaurant was clean.

I wish there were half stars with yelp because I would give this one a 3.5.  While the food was pretty good, and the service was fast.  It seemed very frantic and pushy.  Good food just not the place you want to go unless you are in a hurry.

Very authentic, reasonably priced. I am from 
Chicago and the interior and vibe at China Chili reminds me of Chinatown back home. I just love this place, I eat here 3-4 times a month.

China Chili is back!

It was gone for too long. Basically, China Chili has good chinese food, and is incredibly fast at getting it to your table. You could set your watch to how long it takes them. It would be scary if the food weren't so good.

Get the orange chicken (did I just destroy my credibility for recommending orange chicken? Probably. But just try it. For me. This ain't no Panda Express orange chicken.)

I think as far as the food goes it's pretty average.  Have never been disappointed with the food but it's not "great" by any means.  What I do have a problem with is their service is TOO GOOD.  I'd like a few seconds after I lay down my fork to chew before you come and snatch my plate out from under me.  Servers are all over your table all the time.  I know they assume this is good service but to me it's annoying.  I love good service just as much as the next person does but it does not take 18 (yes I counted) visits to my table and 3 different waitresses to accomplish good service. You got to give them credit for trying but sometimes I think they try a little too hard.  My first visit I was impressed and thought "wow what great service".  The rest of my visits I have just found it overly annoying to have a server at my table 15+ times every time I visit for dinner. Slow down !!!! It's ok if my plate sits on my table for empty for 2 mins even 5+ minutes. Just as long as you eventually clear it BEFORE bringing me my check you'll have accomplished your job of good service.  But 15+ visits from a server EVERY time I've dined here is becoming annoying. I feel like I"m talking to the servers more than my dinner guest.

I'm giving this place 5 stars for one thing. Peking duck. Their duck is by far the best I have had at any American Chinese restaurant. The duck is steamed until cooked then it is flash fried in a wok to crisp the skin. The duck is then cut with bones removed and served with sliced green onions, plum sauce and steamed rice flour buns. I don't live in Arizona but when I am away I dream of Peking duck!

Comida China chingona. Came in here on Friday night, busy night. Wait staff was friendly,  environment was nice, delicious food. Even though they were busy they were friendly and fast, only thing is I couldn't understand anything they say. Order the orange chicken- best orange chicken outside of China.  Don't mind the older gay crowd, they like comida China chingona too.

Came for dinner on weekday maybe 1 to 1.5 hours before closing, with the family when my uncle was in town visiting.  We ordered maybe 8-10 dishes and shared family style.

The majority of dishes I tasted were alright.  The vegetables and tofu generally tasted bland or overcooked.  The Mapo Tofu and Salted Fish fried rice were decently good.  

Near the end we ordered Orange Chicken, and that, was probably the best orange chicken I've had in my life.  Chicken was sliced thin with crispy breaded edges, and good/mild level of orange flavor.  So, if going I have high recommendations for that dish.

For the distance, I would probably not come back again, I'd get something more local that has better dishes overall.

I've driven by this restaurant for decades and always wanted to check it out..So took 2 of my friends there last Friday night and was not disappointed by my meal. The decor is very dated and it looks like any generic family run Chinese/Asian restaurant. The staff was attentive and friendly. Usually I don't order appetizers or soup before my meal but we ordered a large bowl of the egg drop soup which was very good. I ordered Singapore Rice Noodles and was very happy with the entree. All in all it was a good experience, my friends who went with me eat there at least once a week.  The best part is the food is relatively inexpensive, our meal was $32 for the 3 of us, you can't go wrong with that.

Moo Goo Gai Pan was good
Egg roll was ok
Got takeout
Price was right!

This is one of the best places to get Chinese food. I have lived in San Francisco and have had some of the best Chinese food there. You must try the szechuan prawns. They are one of the best dishes like no other and so very delicious, and my favorite when I eat here. I cannot say I am very fond of the service. They tend to move like stealth waiters, all of a sudden out of nowhere they are right at your side taking something off your table. It may seem like the are trying to hurry you out but I do not believe that is their intention. I just ignore them until I am full and ready to leave. One other favorite is the orange chicken
 I highly recomend them for their food.

I love China Chili. The food is definitely Americanized Chinese, but it's also delicious!

Around lunchtime, the frenetic staff buzz about delivering drinks and soups and entrees and checks. You don't really have a waiter as much as you have a zone defense! The lunch menu is consistently good. The service is very, very fast. Considering the large portions, the price is very good.

For dinner, the place is calm and quiet and very pleasant. And the dinner menu is enormous. You could probably eat dinner at China Chili every night for 100 days and not have the same dish twice.

Great for takeout, too!

Some tips:
-If you like Orange Chicken, you will absolutely love the way they prepare it at China Chili. Instead of small, battered chunks of mediocre chicken, they batter a whole juicy chicken breast and then serve that sliced and drowning in the orange sauce. I order this dish about 2/3s of the time.
-The Salt and Pepper Beef is very good.
-Chicken Corn Soup might be my favorite soup ever.

Anyway, now I'm hungry for Chinese food. Time to make a China Chili run!

The food here is really good!  The interior of the restaurant however leaves a lot to be desired, it is very mauve & green. It is your typical Chinese food restaurant, and the servers are not overly friendly. They do however, provide prompt service. This is still the best Chinese food I have had in Phoenix that does not belong to a chain.

China Chili, is quite possibly, one of the best Chinese food resteraunts you'll find in Phoenix.  I've been to a couple of places in the Chinese Cultural Center Plaza (the closest thing to a "China-town" you'll find in Phoenix),  but I still am drawn to China Chili.  

There service is fabulous and the food consistent.   We started our meal with a Chinese beer and appetizers (potstickers, and Veggie-rolls).   The orange-chicken meal was fabulous and all the servings are for two, possibly three people (i.e. easily shared).  I also tried the Sweet and Sour Chicken....so tender and yummy.

We never feel rushed or packed in.  We were there on a Friday night and there was a steady stream of customers, but the service or experience did not suffer.  

Highly recommend.

I ate in and had wonderfully prepared scallops with spicy garlic sauce and the Hong Kong style crispy noodles.  Very authentic and delicious.  Close to getting a five star rating from me except for the limited beer selection.

Fair is fair, I wrote a terrible review for a Chinese restaurant last week, Now for something completely different...we were in Phoenix on a visit, and after last week's disaster at the Chinese buffet where the food was cold, tough, and tasteless, I figured we couldn't do worse...Yelp helped me find China Chili; with 154 reviews and almost all of them 4 or 5 stars, I figured it was our very best shot at a decent meal.

My standards for Chinese food are very high as I lived in San Francisco for 20 years and have been to China for the real thing; so don't take my 3 star rating as disrespect. It's really quite good, certainly the best Chinese I've had since I left San Francisco. 

Décor usually isn't an important part of the experience for me but China Chili is quite attractive inside, it looks small from the outside but was quite spacious inside. Despite being one very large room it was possible to have a quiet conversation. The lighting is quite relaxing without being dim,  and the décor traditional Chinese.

We had Hot & Sour soup, and were asked if we wanted it spicy; we did; it was. Really quite excellent, among the best Hot & Sour I've had. Very rich and full, I was surprised at the shrimp and chicken, which were perfect in texture and taste; the veggies were just the right crispness, the broth was spicy but not too hot, and all in all I really recommend this soup; my companion said it was his favorite part of the meal. He's from rural North Carolina and had never had it before, nor much Chinese. As for me, I'd come back for more.

Next up the Kung Pao Chicken was little disappointing, in that it had too little chicken, too much okra. But it's a minor point, the flavor was delicate and pleasant, the mix of other vegetables offset the okra and what chicken there was, was nice. Unfortunately it was not very spicy, especially after the soup, and so if you order it I suggest you ask for it to be extra spicy. But still a pretty decent dish.

My personal favorite of the meal was the Prawns in Lobster Sauce with black beans. Perhaps a little salty but the flavors overall were delicate, the prawns large, tender, and juicy and no hint of greasiness.

Last we had house special fried rice which was excellent, very fluffy and well seasoned, with beef, chicken, scallops and shrimp. Quite gingery which I like. 

All in all, while it's not up with the very best Chinese cuisine in San Francisco, the food and service were more than acceptable, prompt, unobtrusive, helpful and the price very reasonable, $40 for four dishes and sodas including tax; and the portions were more than generous, we took home more food than we ate (by intention). The Soup alone could have been half the meal...

If you're in Phoenix and you want Chinese, you couldn't go far wrong by choosing China Chile.

Loved this place! It smelled glorious as soon as we walked in. The servers were attentive and the food was delicious. We got the potstickers, veggie chow mein, and orange chicken.  The potstickers were perfectly cooked, steamed with a little bit of crunch. They were truly the best I've had and they were filling too. The chow mein was flavorful and the orange chicken was perfect. It had just enough breading to make it crunchy and had quality chicken. Note, you can get the orange chicken at different spice levels (mild, medium, and spicy). We went for the mild and it was perfect. Can't wait to go back and try more dishes!

The best chinese restaurant in the valley for the price. I highly recommend the half duck, walnut shrimp and house rice. This is our goto place now for chinese restaurants. My friends from the bay area love it too.

With a name like China Chili, you might expect that their food would be a bit on the spicy side. Especially the "House Spicy Chicken," described on the menu as finished with a "spicy garlic sauce." Why then, would it arrive without a hint of heat, and no discernible garlic flavor? It was like KFC and gravy with green onions. The sweet and sour chicken, sweet and sour pork as well as the fried rice, egg rolls and crab puffs - all unremarkable as well. The service is over-efficient to the point of annoyance, and like all Chinese joints, even the younger workers seem to go out of their way to be phonetically incomprehensible. All that said, it's cheap and fast and edible - and the portion sizes are very generous, so... two stars.

Still the best in town! Our old favorites remain the same and hit just the right spot when we are craving Chinese Food. Even if you don't like tofu, try the salt and pepper version. Jalepenos and a paper thin crispy crust surrounding the steaming hot custardy tofu is delicious!

It is chines take out...  Fast good and cheap.

if you like Calimari, order the "Salt and Pepper" calimari.  It is fantastic 4 out 5 times and good 1 out 5 times...  I am addicted to it.   Ask for extra onions and jalapeños!

Everything else is good, and if you are in a hurry for take out, this is your place

The food was ok and the service was very poor. The servers were rude and basically yelling "excuse me" at us when they say the food on the table. I had no idea she was behind me, she didn't need to be so rude. We never got enough silverware or soup bowls. We had to ask for bowls twice and the first server just walked off when we asked. Turns out they were right next to us, so she had no intentions of even getting them since she went the opposite way. I'm not 100% sure but I think my family and I got food poisoning from here. We hadn't been around my in laws before this and yet 24 hours later all of us got severely sick at the exact same time. Hard to imagine it was something else since we don't all live in the same house but got sick at the same time. Will never go back.

Just the worst chinese food ever. Lacks in flavor regardless of dish and the meat was just suspect. Asked other's if their opinion and the responses were the same. Don't do it. You will be disappointed that you didn't listen.

I found this place quite by accident, my friend was looking for a Chili's where we could meet for lunch.  She gave me this address and I was delighted  to find China Chili instead of one of the run-of-the-mill, not even Mexican food Chili's.  

I ordered the House Chicken and was given the choice of spicy or not.  I opted for spicy, it was delicious. 

So many people have complained about the decor, it was simple and to be honest I did not notice what, if anything, they had hanging on the walls, and I really don't care!  I'm there to eat and enjoy the company of my friends.  The food was great, the service was good considering how busy it was for lunch and the prices were reasonable.

I've recently relocated to Phoenix from the east coast and where I came from there was one decent Chinese restaurant in a 50 mile radius.  China Chili is better than the best my town had to offer.
The restaurant looks a little outdated on the inside but the food makes it all worth it.

Celebrating my mother in law birthday, thought this would be a special place to take her. We ordered 2 Mongolian beef. Food was served there was no visible beef on plate just onions and veggies, fried rice was ok. I told my husband at the end to tell the staff they lack beef. In response the waitress told my husband they didn't have enough beef for the second order so they split it...no offer to comp, no apology.

My friend called and wanted to meet for lunch.  I was at Salon Embellish, getting a cut from the awesome Dionne.  I was also on my bike, as per usual!  I did a quick Yelp search to scope out prospects in the immediate area that would be bike-able.  My friend agreed that we'd often talked about China Chili, so we agreed to meet there.  It took me 5 minutes to bike there; I beat my friend by 15-20 minutes.  There is a sad lack of bicycle parking; I ended up locking up to the fence in a designated fire lane.  Businesses with a bike rack automatically earn an extra star from me!

The restaurant is old-school Chinese restaurant.  It's very clean and comfortable.  There are parking and entrances in the front and the back, which is a big plus for a central city business.

We ordered the crab puffs, sweet & sour prawns, and pork mu shu.  We were satisfied with each of these items.  The menu is large and varied; I will most likely return again to try other items.  Located on 3rd St. in central Phoenix, this place is easy for me to access on my bicycle.

Great restaurant for kids and adults--a very extensive menu.  My biggest gripe is that like most Chinese restaurants, there seems to be a lot of variety on the menu but it comes down to about 4-5 different sauces with various combinations of fish/chicken/tofu/beef.  But the sauces are good, and the service is quick and efficient.  I would recommend the soups, Hong Kong noodles, and Peking duck.  All were really delicious.

DECENT LUNCH MENU. The interior is festive and well decorated. Its legit chinese.

My husband and I went here for a lunch date. The thing that was MOST impressive to me was the lighting-fast service. We both ordered from the lunch specials menu (which included and entree, rice, eggroll and hot & sour soup for about $7.50). As soon as we placed our order, the soup was at our table. Our drinks never ran low. Our main meal was out in about 5 minutes. It was FAST! 

The meal itself was good (not SUPERB, but good.). I LOVED the hot & sour soup. I tried the lemon chicken dish and my husband got the orange chicken lunch dish (both good. i liked his orange chicken better). I wish that on the lunch menu they offered some side dishes. -- i would have enjoyed some veggies or tofu options. None of that is listed on the lunch menu. It seems like the dinner menu is a LOT more comprehensive and offers more family style service, but i wasn't sure if they only offered that menu in the evenings, or if you could order from the dinner menu any time.

Good for a relatively inexpensive lunch meal. 
I would love to go back some time in the evening to experience the dinner menu. It looked like there were a lot of tasty dishes worth trying.

My first visit here was around dinner time, Christmas night. All things considered, we were seated within an hour. Really not bad considering how many other people were ahead of us and waiting. Standing room only is an understatement. Shortly after being seated, our waitress was ready for us to order. We needed a minute. She disappeared for a while and eventually a different waitress arrived. Again, Christmas night so no big deal. This place was incredibly busy. We ordered two appetizers and two entrees. Everything came out in a timely manner. My only critique was the appetizers were a little skimpy. I'm not sure if this is usual, or because they were incredibly busy. BBQ pork was especially on the light side. Other than that, No complaints. The Hot and Spicy Sichuan Prawns were awesome. Not what I call even in the same area code as hot or spicy, but delicious. We also had the Pillow Chicken which was a nice balance with the Shrimp dish. This is not the most authentic Chinese I have ever had, but I will go back again for sure if I'm in the mood for Chinese. Something tells me it won't be as chaotic.
On a Friday night restaurant was busy, but the service was top drawer. Food was very good and we will be back. Prices reasonable.
Food was GREAT butttt the prices are high and you can't pay one dollar extra for fried rice you have to buy a whole separate order of rice smh.

This place is the best place to get Chinese food in phoenix! We do not go any where else to get Chinese food anymore. Food is fantastic and so is the service! If you say other wise you just don't like REAL Chinese food and have no eye for good service....Enough said!
Fresh and tasty. No two dishes taste alike and they are always efficient getting orders together. I just wish they delivered!
Service is fast! It's not luxurious but the food is good! They will even pack up your left overs.
Nothing special about this place. Food is horribly bland. I go there once every 5 years.

The food here is pretty good. I got a mushroom soup and it was huge!!  It must have been the family size because the bowl was bigger than my head. The broth was so good though! I tried my friend's dish and it was really good, too. I would definitely come back. I need to try more food here to see if I should maybe give them 4-stars.

They do not use fresh ingredients, or at least they cook so badly to make it seem that way.

People must have to convince themselves that this place is good because it's the trendy thing to do. But you're better off going elsewhere if you want good Chinese food.

Here's a general tip for you guys: if the place isn't predominantly Asian, leave. That's a definite sign that the quality is sub-par. But if you're white and have never had genuine southern Chinese food, you'll probably just barely choke down your "food" and agree with most people that this place is decent.

I've eaten here several times, first because of a recommendation of a friend and other times because people wanted to go here and I was dragged along. The food is underwhelming!  I've tried a different dish each time I've eaten here, and frankly, none were good.  I guess most of the people who give this place 4 and 5 stars are regulars at McDonald's.

This is one of those places that is more of a landmark than a fine dining experience, yet the food is always good. It's quick - at lunch time they have your entree out to you within minutes of order (usually while you're still working on your soup). It's reasonably priced - $8-$10 gets you soup, entree, egg roll and a drink, The lunch crowd is pretty faithful so if you get there after 11:30 you may have to wait for a table. Call ahead and pick it up if you ever have to order lunch for the office. 

I like their orange chicken, mildly spicey. And, I always get the most profound fortune cookies. Today's message " Working with children has a miraculous affect on your spirits." Ahhh.

China Chili, we love your food, service and everything about this place,  it's fantastic!!! One request, maybe a little music in the dining room??? It makes a huge difference in the dining experience.. other than that don't change a thing.

I don't know if it changed owners or what but the service was slow and no one smiled.  When we asked to be seated at a round table for four instead of a small square one--- NO was the abrupt response and no explanations.  Very rude!  Also, there were only 4 groups of people there.  Not even half filled to capacity on a Thursday night around 4 pm.  Ordered the Mongolian beef And orange chicken. The orange chicken was disgusting and very sweet. Also the chicken was very dry and over fried where it was hard and tough.  Panda Express makes a better orange chicken!  Shame!  

The Mongolian Beef was OK , but it was swimming in green onions and white onions on top of a crispy white noodles deep-fried bed.  Disgusting!  The only thing that was good was the hot and sour soup and egg drop soup. The rice was not even jasmine rice used!  Will not be returning to this venue. Very difficult to believe that this was rated highly on KAET channel 8 on a show called CHECK PLEASE.  In the end, all I needed was my check.  Thank you!!!!

I have been here a few times now and the food is pretty good. There are a million options for dishes and what I have had was pretty good. Its not the best Chinese I have ever had but definitely worth a visit.

China Chili is good, but it was better before the city tore down the old little pink shit-hole building and made them move. 

The new space is much larger and I think the kitchen struggles to keep up. The quality of the food is not what it used to be, but Chinese is like pizza- even bad pizza is still good- and China Chili is the same way. The Szechuan green beans were disappointing- they were much too salty. The Mongolian chicken and the hot and spicy prawns are awesome, though. Those two dishes alone almost redeem the restaurant for any other misgiving I ever had about the place. 

The lunch specials are cheap and tasty, the service is quick, and the dining room has no problem accommodating large groups.

Pretty disappointed after reading other reviews. Maybe what they had was good but I was recommended the house ho fun and it was pretty tasteless along with the house chicken. Tried to put chili powder along sweet and sour sauce (which poured out strangely watery) and to no avail. Wouldn't bother giving it a second chance but portions are huge and the service is really great

i wasgoing to give this place a much higher rating until i read the latest county health score in the arizona republic on august  26, 2011. the restaurant was tagged with four critical violations, an unacceptable mark. just the week before, i was with a foodie group that immensely enjoyed the aromas and tastes of the various soups, appetizers and entrees we shared. and a large glass rotating plate in the middle of the large round table made it easy for us to try all the dishes we ordered. i enjoyed the sizzling rice soup. thought the corn chowder a bit bland. portions were enourmous, as were the shrimp in the dishes we ordered which included  fried rice, and a spicy sauce. two of the group ordered orange chicken. not a favorite of mine. but they liked it quite a bit. so, if this place can take care of keeping in clean, and maintain the high standards and ingredients they use to cook their dishes, it will be a top neighborhood hangout. but health comes first, and i will not be going back until i see the next score and hope there is improvement.

Maybe I'm jaded from all the places I've traveled to and lived in, but I honestly didn't see the big deal about this restaurant.  True, their appetizers are decent and the Hot and Sour soup tasty.  But the main dishes we had -- Garlic Eggplant and a half duck -- both very highly recommended by other reviewers, were mediocre at best.  I suspect most Americans wouldn't know "real" Chinese if they saw it  and this restaurant perpetuates the myth, that what they serve is actual Chinese food  (after bringing a friend to a Chinese restaurant off of Northern (Wahsun), which makes real Chinese food, he was shocked to taste what real Chinese food is).  Most of the dishes at China Chili are overly salty and/or sweet  (to be fair though, as a diabetic, I usually avoid both, so I might be overly sensitive on that point).  The service is indeed excellent and friendly.  My biggest complaint was the party of 15 Latinos sitting next to us celebrating a birthday, who apparently think it's okay to have screaming children ruin everyone else's night.  But that's not the restaurant's fault, since machine gunning guests is (still) illegal and there was nothing they could do about it.

In summary, the food here is okay, with the appetizers being their strong suit.  I've tasted much better in the Valley and don't really think this place deserves all the hype it gets.  Then again, there ARE a lot worse Chinese restaurants out here, so this may be your best bet.  It doesn't hurt either, that they're open till 10pm; a remarkable exception in a city, where the norm is to close at 8pm or 9, even on weekends and which, of course, is ridiculous for a "major" city.

I truly recommend "Wahsun" in Phoenix, if you want to try real Chinese food.  I think most people would be surprised to discover how very different it is from what they're used to.  The food takes some getting used to, but once you get into it, you'll never go back to China Chili or their colleagues.

Went to China Chile very recently with four friends. The parking lot was jammed and I thought, this place MUST be good!  Wrong!  I don't understand the stellar reviews of this place...maybe they save the good Chinese food for the dinner service?  Our lunch was just so so and that's being kind.  I ordered the 'special chicken' which was supposed to be spicy.  I ordered it medium and it had NO spice at all...very bland...certainly nothing special.  One friend had the lemon chicken...bland..so so.  The same with the Kung Pow chicken the other three ordered.!  BLAH!

 One friend was a few minutes later than the other four of us, and the server acted like she was just sooo inconvenienced that we couldn't order right away. When we did order, the food came out within 5 minutes!  We couldn't believe it!  It had to be precooked and warmed up...that's what it tasted like. 
I would never go to this place again.  There are too many good choices these days.

Seriously, people giving this place high reviews? When we went here last, the chicken was dry and had a burnt coating that slid right off. And it was somewhat temperate in the middle, confirming my suspicion that this was made earlier and then just re-fried, cut, and served. I don't think any restaurant should get any stars when they just open a can or packet (yes, I'm talking about the vegetables and sauces) and mix with pre-cooked meat. That IS NOT good Chinese food. As someone who has lived where there are actual Chinatowns (Boston and San Francisco), I know what very good Chinese food is, and this place certainly is not.

Oh, and the lighting. Who said that bright, overhead lighting creates a pleasant atmosphere for dining? 

I have yet to find a Chinese restaurant here in the Phoenix area that actually puts together fresh ingredients from scratch. If anyone knows of one, please let me know.
Best orange chicken! They use strips of chicken breast with a thin batter. The orange sauce has a tang to it. All-time favorite! I get take-out so I really can't rate the service but they are fast.

China Chili is the restaurant that Orange Chicken built.  While that dish is tasty, this place has so much more to offer.  Venture away from the lure of the Orange Chicken tractor beam and try such tasty morsels as:

Boiled Won Tons -- a standout dish; the spicy peanut sauce is more like broth than sauce, but in a good way
Chicken Corn Chowder -- a reliable standby
Honey Walnut Prawns -- deep-fried shrimp enrobed in mayonnaise with honey walnuts; what's not to love?
Lover's Prawns -- half the prawns are in wine sauce and the other half are in spicy chili garlic sauce; very balanced
Pillow Chicken -- along the lines of deep-fried chicken croquettes with savory Black Pepper Sauce
Sichuan Style String Beans (with pork) -- a fantastically spicy dish

The lunch menu includes a number of their most popular dishes (including Orange Chicken, of course) that are very tasty and wallet-friendly as they include a cup of the daily soup and an egg roll.

This restaurant is run by a large extended family and the place has a very convivial atmosphere.  The people watching here is great.  The customers represent a broad range of Phoenix residents and there are usually a few gay peeps in the house, which is always a bonus.  

The decor at China Chili really improved when they moved from Central Avenue due to the Light Rail.  This place doesn't have the decor of C-Fu Gourmet, but it is pleasant enough.  The enlarged dining room can now accommodate a crowd, which has really cut down from the long waits at their previous location that was so much smaller. 

Besides table service and take out, China Chili also caters.  The BF and I recently used them for our Tacky Tiki Gay Pride Brunch.  Johnny handles the catering and he's great to work with.  We asked Johnny to create an appetizer buffet, which was something China Chili had not done before.  They did a great job building a custom menu for us and the food was great.  I highly recommend their catering; it's a great way to feed a crowd on a moderate budget.
I have been going here since I was young and they were located on Central, this is a geat place to have good meal family style. #RWJ

Let me preface this review by stating that I've only ordered take out. With that, China Chili is my go to place for those days where I don't feel like cooking and want a quick meal. It's the best mom and pop Chinese restaurant I've ever been to.

I'm a strict vegetarian, and China Chili has been very accommodating. I'd recommend the Hunan Style Tofu with no chicken. 

I'm not a big holiday person, so I'm looking forward to spending Thanksgiving and Christmas here.

Not to be mean but you other yelpers are f**king nuts.  This place is beyond mediocre.  I work across the street and have ate here many times including with co workers and vendors.   The food comes out about 30 seconds after ordering it.  The chicken mean is dry as all hell, get asweet sauce when i order kung pao, etc.   The only halfway decent part is the eggroll with the lunch special and the hot mustard is OK.  Overall if you think this is a 5 star restaurant well you are wrong.  Go out there and try some other places or go to the east coast if you have to.

I've been searching for a good Chinese restaurant ever since my favorite Shangri-La location closed down and I've found it! Their food is so delicious and flavorful. I usually go for the orange chicken and the beef chow mein. I love how their orange chicken are sliced fried cutlets, I've never had it this way until now and I love it a lot more than the other places who make their orange chicken 90% breading and 10% chicken. I still haven't gotten around to taking my friends here yet, but whenever my boyfriend and I are craving Chinese food we always come here.

Always excellent. I reserve 5 stars for anything that wows me. I should give China Chili 5 stars because they're always reliable. It's a good good spot for transplanted East Coasters like me who like Chinese comfort food without an overgrease laden spoon. Love that they know how to pack mushu to go, no added instructions or confusion. Meat & seafood are always fresh, well cooked. Vegan dishes are just that, vegan. No muss, no fuss. The chef can make a dish to order if it's not available on the menu!!! We keep going back for: hot & sour, YuShang, Salt & Pepper, old standards. Their specials are great.  We always try a dash of anything different than what you can't get anywhere else and have not been disappointed yet. Overall very happy we found this gem in the desert!

This place is amazing. Their portions are extremely generous, taste of food is great with the right balance between meat and veggies.

They give you a small cup of soup and an egg roll, service is fast and waiters are very nice.

Had lunch here today after hearing all the colossal raves about it. However, once I walked in, I realized that any semblance of having an authentic Chinese meal went out the window (no offense, my hungry white friends!). 

I decided to try it out anyway, was seated by a friendly waiter and ordered the hot & sour soup (they were able to sub in chicken instead of pork - bonus) and the waiter recommended the house chicken to me. I asked for it to be made really spicy, knowing full well it wasn't going to be (no one EVER listens to me when I demand the food be spicy - listen, dammit, I'm brown, people). Anyway, that's my issue.

The hot & sour soup arrived, and it was excellent. I was happy. Nothing mars a Chinese meal more than beginning it with a bowl of shiteous soup. Then came the house chicken (with string beans added for $1). Steamed rice costs another extra buck - I get annoyed when Chinese restaurants don't make it complimentary, but again, my issue. Anyway, the chicken was just ok. Nothing amazing and it still ended up feeling pretty heavy. So that dish I'm more willing to give it 2.5 stars. 

So why did I bump up the star wattage? I guess the service. 

The waiter:

* noticed I wasn't devouring my dish and offered to switch it for any other dish of my choice, no extra charge. Who does this nowadays - in a Chinese restaurant no less? Extra star.
* is from the SF Bay Area like myself, so he gave me the lowdown for good Asian food in Phoenix (for dimsum he recommended Golden Buddha first, Great Wall second, C-Fu third - then for Vietnamese he recommended some place on 19th Ave between Indian School & Camelback.) He agreed that Thai, Korean, and sushi in Phoenix is kind of a letdown compared to California, but almost all the Asian restaurants (he admitted, including China Chili) cater to their core customers, who by sheer demographics are pretty much not Asian. That said, he told me that China Chili is THE place people go to for Chinese food, including Chris Bianco (of Pizzeria Bianco), the mayor, folks from Channel 10 news, the owner of the Diamondbacks, etc. etc. So take that for what you will.
* When I asked if this China Chili was affiliated with..."oh, the one in Fremont? No. But people say that place is good and fancy and has an electric piano." Bonus points for knowing that.

Anyway, he recommended I come back and get the Mongolian beef next time, which I'll definitely do, plus the hot & sour soup. I didn't mind the big open seating area - many Chinese restaurants in SF are like this, loud and raucous. 

All in all, China Chili is a case where service overcame the food (again, how often does that happen?) to come back and give it another shot. 

And there you have it.

Great Food. Usually a weekly or bi-weekly stop for us.  
They are there to please thats for sure. Never have to worry about your glass getting empty either. 
Maybe sometimes too fast. We've learned to order our appetizers and wait till they get to the table before we order our dinner so it all doesn't show up at the same time. But otherwise a great place for Chinese!

I really like this place. I spent 2 years in Honolulu and used to eat at this great little place in China Town. I have been craving that food since I got off the plane to move back to Phoenix. Well, I found China Chili and I am SO glad I did! The Honey Walnut Prawns are so  yummy! The fried rice and lo-mein noodles are smoky tasting, and hot out of the wok. Is it healthy? Maybe not. Is it non-greasy? Um... not really. Is it delicious when you're craving some really filling Chinese food? Yes. I wish it were closer to my place so I could have it more often, but I'm sure I'm sparing my waistline of more issues!

This place is great for lunch if you are in a hurry. Tons of seating and minimal wait time. Parking is okay though you probably will have to settle for the street or dirt lot across the street. 

The portions are huge! I would dare say you could split a plate and ask for sides of soup and egg rolls. The kung pao is seasoned well with lots of veggies. It is made with dark chicken meat, zucchini, red bell pepper and carrot. The salt and pepper shrimp dish is great. The lemon chicken is very tasty as well. It has breaded pieces of white chicken breast fried crisp and served in a lemony sauce. 

The service is good though about five different waitresses will hit your table from beginning to end. Every time I looked up it was a new person bringing me soup, lunch, water, and the bill. Some smiled - some looked like they were really focused on the job at hand. 

Overall it was a good experience. We've done take out a few times and it is also quick and easy!

This place is delicious! And the staff is very attentive you don't have to call them over for a refill they are all working together and helping out. The food have such a great flavor very authentic and filling!
Every dishes is China Chili is extremely good and delicious!I highly recommended the Orange Chicken,Honey Walnut Prawns and the Peking Duck!!!

My favorite Chinese restaurant here in the Valley! I love the way they seat people, all along the wall to reduce noise. I could actually have a conversation without having to yell. The workers are respectful and quick. I have been there about six times, and each time I get the same thing because it is so good! Best lomein noodles I can find down here. There eggplant soup is amazing as well! I will keep coming here time and time again. The only con is the tiny spot they have for parking...

The orange chicken is so good! It's not deep fried like usual so you don't have to feel so bad in eating it. The walnut shrimp was good but it was too sweet and fatty (sauce) for my liking. But I will defiantly eat here again

I have gone there a few times now because friends have chosen it.  The food is ok.  It is very inconsistent on taste and the look of the meals.  Prices are reasonable for what you get.  Always seem to run into people I know there so others do seem to like it more than I do!

Our go to place for Chinese food when we visit Phoenix. They usually have a good crowd of people. The soups at night are big bowls to share. We've tried the chow mein and the Mongolian beef. We like the broccoli beef too. The service is always spot on. Very friendly staff. They all help take care of all the tables.

Legit chinese restaurant with decent prices and hefty portion sizes. Service is lightning fast which is perfect for a lunch break. Your choice of entree includes a heaping mound of rice plus an egg roll for a side treat. Food was delicious enough for me to want to go back and try other dishes. For now, the Mongolian Beef and MaPo Tofu get my vote!

The lunch menu is all 7.95. The Kung pao dishes are all great. service is top level. Awesome and consistent food top to bottom on the menu. I come here every year with my wife from Alaska. This is one of our mandatory stops while in Phoenix.

I have been here a couple of times but I never reviewd it...it is good Chinese!  It is located on 3rd st just south of indian school rd.  It is a huge restaurant...in fact I do not think I have ever been in an authentic Chinese restaurant that is that large in my life...lol...there is plenty of parking on the side and back of the property.  You walk  in you are greeted by the hostess and they will take you to one of the many many tables...this place is always busy because it is very popular.  The servers are on it...they are used to getting people in and out fast because as soon as you sit down they are asking what you would like...didnt bother me because I like to get my food!  hahaha...they have great lunch specials for no more then seven to ten dollars...i like the kung pao shrimp...lots of veggies and the spice is pretty good...the house chicken is good and I enjoyed the mongolian beef when I had it too!  Once you order your food you will get it in like 5 minutes.  It is good food!  I enjoy it and I will be back!
This used to be my favorite Chinese restaurant near downtown now they raised their prices and are charging for bland fried rice for lunch and the soup looks like a bowl of snot! I will not be back!!
Only thing ive had is the Orange Chicken and white rice. Hands down the best in Phoenix.

I love this place! I've been here a few times now with co-workers, and everytime I come, I leave with leftovers and content with my experience.

The service is great and fast (important for those on a time budget), the food is really good, I enjoy the Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao Chicken, and the prices are very affordable - $6 to $8 for the lunch special. 

It's definitely worth a try!

Temporal cooking at its best! I can't remember how many times I've ordered and the food was out before the water was... you definitely get a LOT of food for the price, and everything I have tried has been awesome.

so we wanted Chinese, and decided to eat at the restaurant. What awesome service. We started with the potstickers ($4.95). They were lightly pan fried. Perfectly chewy with a nice crisp on them. Wifey went with her go to dish, the amaaaaazing Singapore rice noodles with BBQ pork and Shrimp (8.95)  This dish is EASILY enough to feed three people. (yes, she brought most of it home) I went with the salt and pepper pork chops. If I could marry chinese food, this would be my bitch. Holy cow. Awesome thin cut pork chops breaded, salted and served with jalapenos and chives. I don't ever ever ever eat fried foods, but these were seriously one of the best chinese pork dishes ever. Overall, great great great. Super stoked that this place is right around the corner.

I have no idea how or why this place got such good reviews, but we went here specifically because it got such great reviews and we were so disappointed. The food is bland! Like, so bland that chili sauce, duck sauce, and soy sauce didn't even help. I ordered the Thai noodles and it would've been a great dish if it had any flavor or sauce of any kind on it, and my husband got the Yu Shiang chicken. He thought that the sauce was good but the bamboo shoots were undercooked and woody, and the dish was plain all around. Very disappointing considering that there are a huge number of Chinese, Korean, and Thai restaurants in this city that are much better than this place.

I saw this place has great reviews and wanted to try something new. I was completely  underwhelmed with the food. 

I ordered the teriyaki chicken spicy and the crab puffs. The taste of the chicken was gross. I thought at one point I may have gotten duck or something. Not good at all. The crab puffs were awesome.

I gave two stars for the exceptional service and cleanliness. I will not be returning though.

One thing I like about China Chili is they are consistent. Food is always delicious, the portions are big, and the service is fast. The first time I found China Chili via Yelp of course, was on my first business trip to Phoenix in June of last year (2015). Who would have thought that I would move to Phoenix almost two months later!! I work and live less than two miles from China Chili so yes, I am a regular patron now. Please continue to make the best Chinese food in Phoenix and remember that good customer service goes a long way.

This place has been consistently wonderful every time I have eaten here. I typically order the sweet and sour prawns and the kung pao octopus and have enjoyed it each time. The thing to keep in mind is that the service is fast and they will get in and out promptly. Great lunch spot and great place to eat if you have any additional after dinner plans.
China Chili is very good, my favorites include the orange chicken, the pot-stickers, and the vegetable/or beef chow mien, and the chicken corn chowder. Restaurant is clean, and service is good!

YUM.  

The Orange Chicken is great, the Salt and Pepper Shrimp, the House Fried Rice are all fantastic.  But I highly recommend the Dragon meal.  You get Hot and Sour Soup, Chinese CHicken Salad, Crab Wontons, Chicken with Pea Pods, House Fried Rice and Honey Walnut Prawns (Which I suggest you swap for Hot and Spicy Prawns.  They are neither not nor spicy, just reeeeeally tasty).  Best meal!!

A bummer. We had dined at China Chili for several years, but the last experience was a disaster. On Saturday March 15th, my wife and I had dishes we'd loved before, such as chicken with sizzling rice soup and chicken in birds nest (chicken with vegetables with a potato chip like basket).

Within hours, I suffered severe symptoms of food poisoning. Without a day my wife did as well. For the next month, I continued to suffer severe gastrointestinal problems, and remain under a doctor's care. My wife was OK after a couple of days, but this was a nightmare.

This is direct cause and effect. I've never had such severe problems before, and this was the only meal where my wife and I had the same dishes.

I complained to the Maricopa County restaurant examiners, but they weren't interested unless others complained as well. Meantime there is no way I would ever return. I don't need the aggravation.

My husband and another friend went for an early dinner on a Sunday. We were there by 5pm and the place was already hopping! When you order the dinner for 2+, you get a delicious chilled chicken salad, a choice of soup & some of the best crab puffs in town. My friend and I enjoyed the Chicken w/ Snow Peas & Walnut Shrimp. No complaints! Hot, fresh and plenty to take home for lunch at work the next day. My husband enjoyed the Sweet & Sour Chicken. Big pieces of moist, white chicken. We drove from 1-17 and the Carefree Hwy to check this place out. Well worth the trip!

Very good old school style Chinese restaurant. Good service and good sized portions. We took food home. As others have said parking is not good. So you may be driving around a bit. Also the boiled Won Tons are awesome!!

My wife and I got take-out here last week. We got the house special pork and General Tso's chicken. Definitely a cut above typical Chinese take-out (a guilty pleasure I almost always regret immediately afterward, because it's rarely ever really that good). We both felt like it was a little bland though. 

Nothing mind-blowing, but next time I'm in the mood for Chinese take-out, this'll be near the top of my list.

Great place to eat. The staff was very attentive and the food was great. We ordered two sweet and saucy dishes and won't do that again (too much sweet and vinegar with two dishes) but it was all very good tasting. Portions are huge and there were plenty of leftovers.

We had the Hot Spicy Sichuan Prawns which were the best part of the meal.
We had the Orange Chicken which was okay but we wouldn't get again.
House Fried Rice which was very good.
Vegetable Chow Mein which was good also.

Net time we'll get the Hot Spicy Prawns again and get another savory dish as these are plenty sweet.

Highly recommend this place and will be back for sure.

I stumbled across this place when I heard 'chile' for the name of this est.. Well, to cut this short; I am a spicy fave type of guy. I didnt experience any 'CHILE let alone some black pepper for my black pepper chicken.  Had i wanted some dry chicken calamari imposture whatever it was I wouldve payed for the real thing, this est. upset me and I threw it, what they tried to feed me, in the trash. THIS PLACE WAS A DISSAPOINTMENT. I WILL NEVER GO HERE AGAIN. Even if they dared try to redeem what happened.

I haven't had much here, as I live in North Scottsdale. My sister lives a few minutes away, however, and I had the pleasure of having the food here for Christmas dinner. The first time I ate here, I ordered the orange chicken, and I was unimpressed. I'm guessing that flavor depends slightly on which cook they have on. On Christmas, they couldn't answer the phones, as they were packed, so my brother-in-law just went over to order the food. He took a picture of the restaurant, and it looked more like a packed music venue than a restaurant. I think that's the first sign of a good restaurant-locals who regularly visit.
The following dishes were great: Beef with Snow Peas, Orange Chicken, and Hunan Tofu. The Sichuan Prawns, however, were absolutely amazing. I would gladly drive the 20 minutes or so there and back for this dish alone. My sister and my brother-in-law order the orange chicken regularly, but my order on  Christmas converted her to the Prawns. Unfortunately, he has the palate of a 3 year old picky eater and doesn't eat seafood, so she can only have them on occasion. 
There was a write-up on the prawns in Phoenix magazine within the last 6 months or so that made the writer sound like a complete idiot who likes to talk about nothing at all and has no way of actually discerning different flavors in a dish, but the one thing I would agree with him or her is that the Prawns are excellent.
My name is Stirling Peters.
Boiled wontons are delicious! Order them spicy and with some white rice! Place can be crowded but the wait is rarely long.

We were driving around & decided to Yelp nearby restaurants. China Chili popped up in the list & had received good reviews, so we decided to stop by. The parking spaces in front & behind the restaurant are limited & when we got there, there were no spots open so we had to park on the street. When we walked in, we noticed the restaurant was much larger than it appeared from the outside & was pretty busy - a good first sign.

We were promptly seated & brought our drinks. We ordered the Fried Golden Prawns for an appetizer and the Chicken in Phoenix Nest & Sesame Chicken for our meal. The prawns were good but nothing special. There were sweet & sour and horseradish sauces on the table which were the only reason that the prawns had any taste. As for our meal, the Chicken in Phoenix Nest was in an interesting tasting sauce - the first couple of bites were good but left a weird after taste. I only ate 3 or 4 bites. The Sesame Chicken was the same way. I understand that it's a different preparation than the sweet American version but this plate just had a bunch of slices of fried chicken with a gravy tasting sauce poured on top. I only ended up eating about 4 or 5 bites of this as well & was done.

Additionally, one of the things we noticed was that our waiter was really nice. We had a few questions about the menu & he was more than happy and nice, answered everything. Some of the ladies who were waitresses there, however, were not friendly. They glared at people when walking around picking up plates & dropping off meals. It was a little un-comforting / intimidating to get these looks while eating. Overall, due to the taste of the food & experience, we probably will not be back.

This place is a hidden treasure. I drive by it all the time, and never checked it out because it seemed kind of grungy from the outside. However, it always looked busy, so I thought I'd give it a try.
My large family and i ordered A LOT of food. We all shared it and had leftovers for days. We ordered the shrimp fried rice, the moo shoo vegetable, the spicy eggplant, crab puffs, spring rolls, orange chicken, vegetable egg-foo young, and a couple of other things that were great. Their food was delicious. One of the best Chinese restaurants in the valley, for sure. Their crab puffs and moo shoo vegtable stood out to me. My dad loved the orange chicken and said that in his 72 years of life, it was the best orange chicken he has ever had. 
I recommend this place. They have great lunch specials, as well. The service is amazing and the women are very attentive. Our drinks were always full. 
We will definitely be back many times.

Absolutely some of the best Chinese I've had in Phoenix since I came out 7 years ago from NYC.  I ordered delivery through DoorDash and ordered Pork Fried Rice, Mu Shu Pork, Half Duck, and Singapore Rice Noodles.  Each dish was absolutely marvelous!  So glad I've finally found Chinese so tasty.

We've been looking for a good, dependable Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood for several months, but didn't find anything exceptional.  We tried China Chili last Saturday on sort of a lark, and were totally delighted. The food was excellent, service was fantastic and for 2 people, with appetizers, soup, 2 entrees and plum wine it was only $40 (with food to take home!).  The only issue is that the room is cavernous, but if you've ever tried places in NYC or SF Chinatown, you will feel right at home.

We shared potstickers, cream cheese puffs, orange beef, house special chicken and sweet and sour chicken. The sweet and sour sauce was amazing and the chili sauce for the potstickers was awesome. None of it disappointed. We would recommend this over and over.

Ehhh, its ok. The best thing about this place is the service. We were in a large group of people and everyone was taken care of as if there were only a few of us. They even put our outside cake in the fridge for an after dinner celebration.

The food...it doesn't taste bad...and then again it isn't remarkable. I always end up (this wasn't my first visit) with the same thing, Garlic Green Beans and Fried Tofu. This is the most critter-less dish i can find on the menu. I don't know how you get so much grease outta green beans and fried tofu...I'm talkin' pork dish grease. Ok, so that's my gripe.

I'm pretty sure i'll go back for another birthday celebration or when there's a large group of people trying to decide what will satisfy everyone, or when i need a quick lunch that's not drive thru.

I was covered in the spicy prawn sauce and the stray cats in my ghetto neighborhood surrounded me, trying to lick it off me.... Then I woke up and realized it was the most horrible dream I've ever had!

This dream occurred the same night I had China Chili again after a long hiatus. I used to come here all the time for lunch when I worked closer. The lunch specials were great, about $10 for soup, a wonton, an eggroll and my favorite SPICY PRAWNS. 

The prawns were tempura-battered, deep-fried and drenched in a spicy, tangy sauce and served over rice. It usually has been very good for me. However, my recent experience left me drinking lots and lots of water. Not that it was spicy or anything but the sauce has gotten EXTREMELY salty. 

Did they have a change in chefs? Am I just more sensitive to salt? I'm not sure but this was not the same China Chili I once knew and loved. Now I only, "like" it.

My friend and I were interested in trying a new place in Phoenix and we found this through yelp. Rated high so I was looking forward to it. It's a nice, older Chinese restaurant. Decor is a bit outdated but it felt like a throwback to one of my favorite Chinese restaurant. 

Service was nice. Not overly attentive but enough. We ordered beef fried rice, salt and pepper pork chops and house chicken. Every dish was delicious. It felt like a lot of compare and contrast to other places we've been but we thoroughly finished everything. We liked how the fried rice had more eggs then most places. We like how the seasoning of the pork chops was on the batter and not the meat. Tasty! The chicken was crispy and the sauce had the right amount of garlic to it. Order it on the side not on top!

Overall, I enjoyed the place. A tad bit pricey compared to others but good food. We'll come again in the near future to try other dishes.

We love this place! When compared to the other places in Phoenix, China Chili is at the top.  My favorite is the Black Pepper Sizzling Beef. Pork Imperial Sauce is also a favorite. Service is good and friendly.

My favorite chinese dish is honey walnut shrimp. One day I was searching for a place that has honey walnut shrimp. After I read all the great reviews, I was sold and I had to give this place a chance. The dish is very good. Will definitely be eating here again!!

China Chili is a great spot for lunch if you are craving some Chinese in the city. I had the Orange Chicken and my dad had the Sweet and Sour Chicken. Both were excellent! The lunch specials include a cup of the soup of the day, rice, and a spring roll all for under $8! My dad and I are both big guys and we couldn't even finish half of our meals. The service was very good. The servers all float around and split the tips so we had 4 or 5 different people help us refill drinks, bring the check, and to-go boxes. A must try if you are in the mood for good quality Chinese food!

Downtown Phoenix is severely limited when it comes to good Chinese food unless you venture off into the suburbs or head towards the Chinese Cultural Center. For this part of town however, China Chili was definitely my go-to place. They've got a cheap lunch special and had an oddly nice dining hall. The service is always very attentive and the prices are fair. The food is a mixture of authentic Chinese dishes with the occasional Americanized dish here and there,so it caters to nearly everyone. Vegetarian friendly and good for groups, China Chili was the place I went when feeling home-sick for Los Angeles and in dire need of some good won ton soup, but didn't have a car or time to go to the Cultural Center. Not my favorite, but gets the job done. Just slightly less greasy than Siu Wok down the road.
Amazing food!!!!! You must go, authentic and delicious :) My favorite is the orange chicken and shrimp fried rice!! This food is great for a Netflix night and Chinese food!
Found this great restaurant when I first moved to the area and really enjoyed the food. I was there at a slow time so received excellent service.

I always hear hype about China Chili...now I've been there a few times and it is decent but nothing to rave about.  Unfortunately I never made it there prior to the big move but I really cannot imagine that much changed in the way of food greatness.  My vote still goes to GHoHK.
A local favorite of mine. Fresh and quick. No small talk from the servers but I don't mind. The food is always delicious and hot. Great spot to check out. Try the lemon shrimp or the king pap duo.

My first review of China Chili was 4 stars. After today's experience I am down to 1 star. I had Kung Pao Chicken and my wife had Lemon Chicken. I like it spicey but this was just sour. I had to leave it. My wife enjoyed her Lemon Chicken but 1 1/2 hours later became sick to her stomach. I wonder if anyone else had a similar experience there today. We have been there several times and were always pleased with everything. This was the first time we had this type of experience. Service was good, food was not.

My husband and I rode our bikes here last weekend for dinner. We loved it! The decor is a little old timey and charming and the food was delicious! We ordered the mushroom soup, crab puffs, vegetable chow mien, and scallops. It was all really good and now we know why this spot is always packed! We'll be back!

After being sat we waiting 20 mins before anyone even acknowledged our party. The food was really basic Chinese food nothing great about this place. I ordered some egg rolls and they were smaller than a spring roll, so disappointed. The only thing I could say good about this place was the Chinese beer. I would only go back for that only.

My friend was starving and wanted Chinese food after being on the road for a full day coming from California. So glad we stopped here! The food was good and our bill came out to $39 for 1 appetizer and 4 main plates.
We walk to China chili during our short lunch hour hour. They get us in and out in exceptional time. The food is great especially the orange chicken. Will keep coming back!

Came in for lunch with a very close friend , I ordered the sizzling rice soup and the fried prawns for an appetizer. Both were quite tasty,the prawns were quite large,and not overly breaded.The soup was very tasty , and much like other reviewers , we barley finished when the main courses came out.
I ordered the kung pau beef, my companion ,the snow white chicken . Both were very good, and the portions were so large ,we both had an extra meal out of it. Would definitely come back again, although, I do question the claim of best Chinese in Phoenix.

I ate here with some coworkers for lunch. The place was definitely busy. I would say the food was just okay. I had the orange chicken and have had better versions at other restaurants. The fried rice was not the greatest. My lunch was on the cheaper end but I really don't need to go back.

Still the absolute worst customer service! Wow I keep giving them a chance and the fail. Throw my plate in front , eat with three of us and they bring one plate at a time with about 5-10 min between . I am done wasting my time and money on this place for subpar food
Always great food and service! I love the pillow chicken, the sizzling rice soup, and the hot and sour soup! Consistently great!

The food is fantastic and the service is awesome.  They can customize some dishes and very accommodating.  The owner Sally is always there and its great, affordable and quality good tasting food.  I love the salt pepper pork, shrimp, scallops, etc...  Good Chinese food for Phoenix.

We ordered Hot and Sour Soup, Salt and Pepper Prawns and Honey Walnut Shrimp.  It was very good and quite inexpensive. Their dinner selection is more extensive and more authentic than their lunch choices.

I love this restaurant. It's a favorite locale for my husband's family and I love going to dinner with them here. It's always a very positive experience. My favorite part is the lazy susan centerpiece. We all order our own plate and have it placed in the center. Everyone shares and we all get a bit of everything. It makes for a very diverse meal. 

I love their boiled wanton soup here. It has just the right bit of kick. I crave this like crazy and can't get enough. I love any of their shrimp dishes and often order shrimp chow-mein. I also highly recommend their orange chicken. It's among the best that I've ever tasted. It definitely beats Panda Express.

The environment is casual and friendly. There's always a buzz of conversation, but its never overly loud. The staff are really great and will have a drink refill on the table for you before you're even halfway done with the first one. It's very clean and well decorated. This place certainly attracts a crowd, but you wouldn't know it from the great service. It's definitely a perfect place for large families. You get incredible food for a very affordable price and the somewhat calm environment allows a great opportunity to socialize.
Still the Best in Town hands down. I've never had a bad meal here and the service is always tip top.

The best in Phoenix!  We have been going to China Chile for many years....while they were at their old location.  I know there is better chinese food in other cities, but it's the best Phoenix has to offer.  We have many choices of mediocre Chinese restaurants.  This is NOT mediocre!  First we always start with the boiled wontons.  If you haven't tried them, you are in for an outstanding surprise.  We had never eaten them in other restaurants, even LA or SF or NY.  These are causing my mouth to water (as I sit here writing the review!)because they are sooo delicious.  We ask them to not put chiles in ours, but they are still fabulous.  We like their eggplant, Moo Shu, Singapore noodles( new for us last nite and we would order again.) Honey Walnut Prawns are yummmm, the lettuce leaves with minced chicken are really good.  We've had thier noodles, their various soups, various pork dishes.  WE have always walked out of China Chile saying "too bad it's so far from our home"  But we still trot back there at least once a month!  Restaurant is pretty attractive, and quite large, the same staff has been there for years. You won't be disappointed!  It's a winner!  Oh I forgot one other thing we like: The Lover's Prawns.  After eating here so many times, we are very pleased to have China Chile in Phoenix!

Best Chinese food in town.... they do salt and pepper EVERYTHING (Chicken, pork chop, shrimp, and squid)! 
Not to mention they are quick! You can call them up and no matter how big the order is it will be done in 15 minutes. I always joke about it but it's not a laughing matter when other restaurants have you waiting.
The food is phenomenal, definitely recommend the chicken fried rice and the orange chicken.

Being a Visitor in PHX for a week and looking for a good Chinese food, specially that the first attend to eat at a Chinese restaurant failed. 

I had to reach out to my FB friends who Recommended this place. And they were right, love the food here and the service was efficient. 

Tasty food indeed, this place is the bomb! :-)

This restaurant is pretty good. They are friendly, make and serve your food fast, and the prices are reasonable. The ambiance is OK but not romantic. It's more like a group cafeteria setting but comfortable. The food is tasty.

Great place to get some delicious and legit Chinese food.  Do not expect speedy service but the food is worth the wait and we all need to slow down anyway.  No need to rush all the time :) Kung pao chicken and fried bananas are both among the best I've had.  Check it out for yourself.

Two words: Boiled Wontons. If you pass by them on the menu without ordering them, you have missed out on one of their best appetizers. As other reviews have mentioned, China Chili's orange chicken is on point and their service is swift. Highly recommend this place if you are craving some Chinese food and are in the area. You honestly can't go wrong with any item on the menu.

This was one of the best Chinese Restaurant experiences I've ever had...everything was delicious...there were dishes there I've never seen offered before. This was my first time there but will definitely eat here again when in Phoenix!

There is really one reason that I go to China Chili all the time...The boiled wontons.  The rest of the food is pretty typical chinese fare.  Best to take a group of friends and mix and match dishes. 

Our favorite dishes here, besides the boiled won tons, are the spicy eggplant and the green beans and tofu.  We order them extra spicy to kick it up a notch. Even extra spicy and Dan will load up both the boiled won tons and the dishes with the hot sauce at the table.  In fact we usually leave the hot sauce jar empty by the time we leave the restaurant.  

Parking is a bit hard to find on busy nights there and I usually end up parking on the street.  

The portions are gigantic and I always have take away dishes for the next day.

Prices are reasonable.  If you do order the soup realize you can order it and share for the table.

Super cheap, authentic... and delicious local Chinese food. The restaurant is always packed and the staff busy but decently attentive. They never lack on the amount of the food on the plate for the price. Good place to go for lunch with friends/coworkers.
