This place was pretty solid. I ordered the sesame chicken and I was lost in the sauce (in a good way). The sauce was really sweet and went perfectly with the lightly battered chicken. I would say the only con was the fact that the dish came with a small amount of rice.

I'm excited to return and try more of the dishes!
Food tastes good and service is very good as well. We ordered egg flower soup, mapo tofu, house special chicken and vegetable deluxe. Egg flower soup and mapo tofu were especially good.

The food quality was really good. I ordered the orange and kung pao chicken with a side of chow mein and fried rice. My only dissatisfaction was with the kung pao chicken but I usually only order it for the family so I don't think I can really say what good kung pao chicken is supposed to taste like. All the rest of the food even tasted great the next day after reheating.

I must admit that tonight being Christmas Eve was not the best night to go, but they should be prepared for the business that they're going to receive on Christmas Eve.

We ordered $85 drink and food for a party of four.  The staff that Sally had on that night was insufficient, badly equipped, very impatient and rude.

Our appetizers Eggrolls, Crab Ragoons were cold, geasy and soggy!  The soup was Luke warm to room temperature!
I brought it to my servers attention and she never came back to the table and totally ignored me the table next to ours have the same problem I don't know what their outcome was. 

After dinner,
I took the Sally the owner aside privately and told her that I was not satisfied with the appetizers but the dinner was good!  I also told her the soup was cold. 

This was not the first time I've had a complaint with China Chile.  They always have an excuse!  Denying anything that they did wrong and make they make no exceptions on the bill and offered no apologies.  Sally is always right!  I will never spend another dollar in that establishment. There are many other Chinese restaurants in the Phoenix metro area to go to that are accommodating and respectful to their customers!  China Chili's decour is dated and cheap! The atmosphere makes you feel cheap and cheated.  Lighting in many areas is poor The food is expensive, it's mediocre at best!   The bathrooms are filthy dirty and there's no hot water in the mens room.  I intend to call the health department!  If they can't provide hot water and a clean bathrooms  in the establishment,  I shutter to think how dirty the rest of the restaurant is and what other health codes they are breaking?  

There is absolutely no excuse for saying NO to the customer when they say they are unsatisfied with the service or food!  

She's going to learn that one dissatisfied customer can create fifty more by social media and I intend to be the one to make her learn that!  If I were you I would dodge a bullet and never frequent this business!     

I found it absolutely infuriating that she had the audacity to come to our table and tell me I was wrong and that she would be willing to do nothing and offered no apology no exception on the bill. I must also inform everybody on YELP,  that we tipped the waitress her 20%. Unlike Sally the owner we realize that it was a holiday and that her employees should not be punished for her lack of poor management. 

I also need to mention that we all became ill after the meal and I am sure it had to do with the Eggrolls and the Crab Ragoon.  I wasn't as sick as two others that decided it was too much of a hassle to complain about it. So I only ate half of each. 

I frequent many restaurants here in the Phoenix area and I would do yourself a favor and avoid giving this establishment your hard earned money and respectable business. 

There is a new business that seems quite impressive,   a restaurant directly across the street from China Chile that has excellent food,  excellent service ample parking for the same money!

Parking is a little  difficult.  But service  makes up for it . There must  be an army in the kitchen.  We  recommend  pork fried rice. Sinapore noodles. Salt and pepper  pork chops . Eggs and shrimp.
Excellent and fast service during lunch hours. Over priced Mediocre food.

Had the hot & spicy Sichuan Prawns, expecting too hot, but had the right kind of spice! Yum, yum, yummy. Wish the would Chinese Fried Chicken more often, last time I tried to order, they had run out, so had crispy duck. It was good, but still wish it was crispy chicken...LOL

A lot of people from work seem to like to go here. After being there several times I still dont get what the fuss is. Maybe its because they are quick with turn around? They sure can move food to the table very quickly and get you out fast.

As far as taste goes, I have had better. With the Chinese Culture center not too far away either, I would chose that place over China Chili any day. A couple co-workers after having been there over the course of several years seems to be in agreement with me as well. If someone recommends it, we usually know of a better chinese place downtown than China Chili.

I've been enjoying lunches and dinners here over the years with friends, with my swim team, and with visitors and guests. Each and every time the food was delicious, served in generous portions, and it didn't take long for food to be brought to the table even when I was with relatively large groups. While definitely Asian, the flavors lean a bit toward westernized - not a bad thing here, really; the food is always very tasty. I especially love how they prepare their fish: really tender and succulent. I also recommend their  tofu dishes and if you want a different spin on this Asian beancurd staple, try their pillow tofu. The restaurant itself is big and spacious, a bit gaudily decorated as most big old-fashioned Chinese restaurants are, and the service is fast and efficient. Oh ... and something to keep in mind now that the holiday season approaches: they're open on Christmas Day ;)

Service  is always  great . Food will be on your table so fast . Food is fresh and hot . Parking is a problem.  Portions  are large. My favorite  is Peking duck . Dumplings.  Salt and pepper  pork chops. Pork fried rice

I can't get enough; my absolute favorite Chinese food in Phoenix. The duck is top notch, I love the tofu with string beans and basically everything else I've ever tried, the service is fast, friendly and efficient. I highly recommend China chili- I even have it in speed dial  five stars!

This is one of those places that is basically overrated just because of its location and longevity. There are so few places that have survived in the downtown Phoenix area for as long as China Chili has, and for that, it probably does deserve a lot of credit. 

That being said, it's basically an average Chinese restauant. Comfortable, convenient, clean, and it offers all the standard fare. It's everything you'll need for a weekday dinner, but not much more.

Try the sizzling rice soup. It's very good. Plus Jerry Colangelo is known to take out their sweet 'n' sour shrimp...or is it the chicken? Who cares, either way, that's pretty cool.
Best chinese food in central Phoenix Lin's is better but this place is really good to..
Pretty good food. Shows up hot & fast and the service was some of the best I've had. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.
solid place that is fast and good for a work lunch. Come here with my coworkers at least twice a month and the food is consistent and solid.
Just came from China Chili for lunch. First time for me. The service was very fast and friendly. The food was fine too, nothing really special but fine. I would go back if in the neighborhood.

This place is OK. Nothing above the ordinary, but not below average either.
The food is good, the service so so . I have heard so many good things about this place that maybe I was dissapointed when I was not overly impressed with it.

Very little parking, bathroom is clean.
Food comes out nice and hot and the tea is decent. The place could use a bit of a shine up for sure. Prices are good though. I would go back for sure.

Short: Great consistent food. Good lunch deals. I get the House Special Chicken. Maybe a dollar or two expensive for the type of Chinese food it is.

Longer: Been going here for years and when I worked nearby I would go frequently at lunch. Their lunch specials are great and comes with soup and a vegetable egg roll. The only problem is that it's maybe a dollar or two too expensive for the type of chinese food it is. It's nothing fancy, just good solid Chinese food. The place is pretty big but is always packed when I go. 

I personally get the House Special Chicken. Other good items depending on your mood:

Appertizers: Veggie Egg Rolls, West Lake Soup

Seafood: Almond and Cashew Nut Prawns

Chicken: Besides the House Special Chicken, Chicken in Black Bean Sauce

Pork: Sweet and Sour Pork

Also, I get the fried rice which is an extra $1 at lunch.

Service is super fast especially at lunch, otherwise, typical Asian service, not very personable and even if they were, it may be difficult to understand so maybe it's better to save for the awkward conversation anyways. Also, I'm not one for overly friendly (fake) service anyways, so it's not necessarily a bad thing.

If you like Chinese Buffets, then this place is not for you.  China Chili is probably the most authentic Chinese food I've had in AZ.  Makes me feel like I'm in New York, or better yet, CHINA!  I have a theory when it comes to Chinese food - if there are lots of Asian people there, its prbably good, because for them its food.  Order the orange chicken, salty squid, eggplant in garlic sauce or the mayonaise shrimp and walnuts.  All are out of this world!  I even had my wedding rehearsal dinner, that's how much me and the family love this place!  The staff are attentive, courteous and happy to answer any questions you have.  It doesn't get much better than this!

A bit disappointed with the taste of food here, as the restaurant really looks inviting, authentic with great and fast customer service. Hot and sour soup was good. My Mongolian beef lacked spices and a kick. Egg foo young was swimming in a sauce that could have had more depth in flavor. Still looking for good Chinese in Phoenix.

Ok, so I lived in Chicago and California with the best Chinese food. Been in Phoenix for six years and haven't found good Chinese food until now!!! China Chili is the best!!!! They make amazing Shrimp Fried rice and Orange Chicken. Good service and great atmosphere. You have to check this place out.

China Chili strikes again. We are not big Chinese food eaters but whenever we do have a craving, China Chili does not disappoint. We end up eating here about 4 times a year and are always happy. Tonight we had the orange chicken, house chow mein and ss pork. Nothing too adventurous but great taste and great price. We highly recommend it!
Ducks on the menu. I love a roasted duck meal. Woo way to much for just me but it was every bit of delicious.

Bomb!! 

Bomb orange chicken... Not like weird
Mc nuggets covered in sauce. We order it extra spicy 

Szechuan beef so so

Bomb egg rolls 

Bomb pot stickers 

Bomb spicy mustard

Came in with my co-workers a few times and had to write a review.  This place just blew me away.  The amount of good food you get for such a small price was shocking.  My order of Mongolian Beef was practically falling off the plate and after everything including tip I only forked up $10.  Place is quick as well which is a big plus for lunch hour plans.

Highly recommend this place for anyone working near the Capitol.

Service was friendly as always. However, the food was very bland. And the rice was burnt. The soup, the rice, the Mongolian beef, and the broccoli chicken was BLAND. Even the egg rolls were BLAND. The only flavorful thing tonight was my Coca Cola. Today was not their day.

China Chili is back. It's now located near 3rd St. and Osborn. I never ate IN the restaurant at the old location --- I always ordered take-out --- but I have now eaten at the new restaurant twice.

The food is as good as you remember. Delicious, generous portions of Chinese in every chicken, pork, beef and seafood option you can imagine. 

My only criticism is the new location itself. While it is larger than that previous, two things bother me about it.

First, it is one giant room. You can see everyone and everything. I might be used to having booths or partitions to help create a smaller more intimate feel, but I felt a little exposed. Of course this is a bonus if you like people watching. You can pretty much spy on anyone depending on where you are seated.

The other thing I find odd is the room itself. It is VERY well lit. (Again, a bonus if you are into checking out what the table across the room is having. Not so much if you want to have an intimate dinner.) Many huge, brightly-shining chandeliers adorn its ceiling and every one is one. No burnt out bulbs here.

But like I said, the food is still the real draw. I may just stick with ordering take-out.
Huge portions, order two items and it will serve four. In a funky location but really good "American Chinese" food.

A truly authentic Chinese restaurant.The Boiled won tons are outstanding.We also ordered the Singapore noodles ,equally as good.The lettuce leaves are wonderful. In fact almost every dish is worthy of praise. 
Service is good. The wine list is fairly priced . Also worth mentioning,  it is a kid friendly Restaurant.

Wow! what a great meal last night. Kinda nervous to go back after being there a cpl of years ago for lunch and not loving it. BUTTTTT 2 words: Boiled Wontons. Order these and u will prob crave them for days. Spicy broth with boiled wontons in a light peanut sauce. I also ordered my fave, Peking duck. Very impressed with the quality and will be going back more. They do bring the food out superman fast so you kinda feel rushed but other than that, i see why they are sooo packed.

If I could put 0 I would. I'm from San Diego and I'm used to eating decent food! The food here is garbage and so is the service. The salt and pepper chicken did not taste or look like chicken, it looked like battered chicken skin.  If you want to try delicious Chinese food, make the drive to San Diego, you will never want to come back and eat here.
Order the Salt & Pepper Shrimp, and Dip it in sweet and sour sauce! Everything was Delicious! Highly recommended

Very good food. Don't like their sweet and sour sauce or their pillow chicken but they can sure pull off a mean sesame chicken and those boiled won tons are to die for! 

I haven't gotten to test out their duck yet but their food has me wow'd compared to some of the crap I've gotten from other Asian restaurants near the area!

Definitely give this place a try and more than once because not everyone likes the same things, but you will find a dish you like on their menu, believe that!

We stopped in for lunch this weekend after not visiting for over 10 years. 
We were warmly greeted and quickly seated.  We ordered the steamed potstickers to share and I enjoyed the snow white chicken with snow peas, mushrooms and chicken in a white wine sauce with a side of rice.  The portions were pretty large and the food was quite tasty.  We'll definitely add China Chili to the repeat list whenever we're looking for good Chinese food.
Solid Chinese food in Phoenix. Big portions, decent prices.

Finding a traditional Chinese restaurant that serves more than just fried rice, orange chicken, mongolian beef and the usual staples is always a satisfying experience, especially when EVERYTHING ON THE MENU IS FANTASTIC! I've found my go to Chinese place when I'm in Phoenix and that is China Chili. 

Walking through the 100+ degree weather to get some Chinese food didn't deter me, although I was drenched by the time I got there. Inside it looks like your usual Chinese dine-in place with the low lighting, cheap leather seats and rather large round tables. I was promptly greeted and my order taken, I got fried rice, prawns, soup, orange chicken, etc. All of which was surprisingly cheap and after a 15 minute wait decent sized portions.

When I got home even though the food has gotten cold it was still great! I can only imagine what it would be like fresh. Everything was flavorful and cooked to perfection. My family thoroughly enjoyed things over the next couple of days. 

Overall, great food, good atmosphere, friendly staff. Next time I'm in Phoenix I'll make sure to stop by here.

Went today with co-workers for lunch.  It's my first time there.  The place was busy but we didn't have to wait to get a table.  Our orders were taken soon after.  
We all had the soup of the day which was hot and sour soup.  It was decent, not bad. I ordered the Kung Po Fish from the lunch menu.  The food came out really fast.  The potion was big and the taste was fine but a little bit too sweet.  It came with egg roll and white rice.  I only finished eating half the meal and had the rest including the whole egg roll put in a 'Kari out' box.  

I think I would come back to try other food.  But, I really hope they would have more choices on the lunch menu.  The current lunch dishes are mostly deep fried or battered.  More stir fry or less sweet on the sauce would be nice.
China Chili has been our go to Chinese food spot for years and years. The best Chinese food restaurant in Phoneix.

I swung by after a Last Chance session and picked up takeout. It was super duper fast and quite inexpensive. I couldnt wait to tear into the goods when I got home. When i did, I was unimpressed.

The lunch special Kung Pao Chicken was filled with gross dark meat chicken "parts" that I didn't even feed to my dog. The shrimp fried rice was overly salty, oddly colored, and not very tasty. I am still on the hunt for a GOOD chinese place here in Phx. This definitely wasn't it.

Love this place. Great service. Huge portions. Love that I never have to ask for a refills on drinks. Every dish I've ever had at this great place has been delish.  I'm hooked. We go here at least once a month. Faves: Lemon chicken & Mongolian beef. Dang...it's almost 10pm and now I'm craving China Chili!!!!

Best boiled wontons. Get them everytime. If you like garlic and peanut sauce you will love them. OMG and they wontons are a very good size dumpling. I always ask for extra peanut sauce and alittle more spicey and it's wonderful. Enjoy my friends.

Based on so many comments on Yelp, my wife and I visited today for lunch.  I had sweet and sour chicken.  Wife had sweet and sour shrimp.  We both were impressed with the size of the dining room.  Service was swift and immediate.  We both thought our dishes, although good were nothing out of the ordinary.  Both tasted bland and well....just ordinary.  We were only given a lunch menu which was a bit limited.  The dishes that other yelpers reviewed about must have come from the evening meal servivce.  They sure weren't on the lunch menu.  Prices were good.  Service was good.  Lunches were from a steam table I'm sure.  Based on what we saw today, I don't think the place merits a trip back.  We live near Glendale and 35th ave.  The food is hardly worth the trip.  May try again some evening but doubt it.  There are so many good restaurants closer to us that bland unseasoned food is hardly a magnet.

The reviews for this place are about as far off as they can be. Yes it's cheap but Panda Express makes a better plate and I refuse to eat at panda. Staff is rude, food is bland. Yelpers....... you have failed. I live a block away and won't be returning.

One of my favorite quick, easy and reliable work day lunch spots!!!!  Carryout or dine in, you can't go wrong. I personally have an hour lunch and this place is a 5 minute drive from my office. I can sit down, enjoy my food, mingle with co-workers AND get back to the office with my doggy-bag and not feel rushed!  

My favorites are the orange chicken and sweet and sour chicken. I appreciate that for their lunch special you not only get your entree and rice, but also a spring roll AND their soup du jour!!!  Yum Yum  Yum! There are always left overs (well if you're me) and sometimes I share with a co-worker and it's just enough for two ladies.

The lettuce wraps were very flavorful and a huge portions for 2 people.  The plum sauce complemented the wrap well and it was tasty.  

The egg drop soup, the Kung Pao Chicken & Black Bean Chicken was a large portion of food,  and had great texture and consistency.  Unfortunately, those entree were slightly bland for my taste

Lots of seating & pretty good Chinese food! The sesame chicken & house chicken are delicious & a nice change from the breaded nuggets like most places serve, this was a whole pieces of boneless chicken that's fried then sliced. The noodle dishes are pretty good as well. Service can be hit or miss.

Fast service, good prices. I ordered the special shrimp fried rice it was delicious. I also ordered the Chicken corn soup. This place is huge! It's a stand alone building. Perfect for any large event or outing I would think the restaurant can host over 200 people.

Bland taste for what this restaurant's reputation has in the neighborhood.  I was not impressed at all.  I had Sweet and Sour Chicken, Pork Fried Rice and Wonton Soup.  Nothing to write home about.  It didn't WOW me.  The rice was very sticky, the soup was very bland in richness and the Chicken had a Boneless Buffalo Wing texture to it.  

Lucky Kitchen down the street is cheaper and is more authentic in taste.

GREAT CHINESE! I came here during a business trip to PHX and was told to go here by the locals. Everyone including my Lyft driver praised this place. I ordered the Mongolian Beef and it was very good. Very flavorful and chocked full of beef, which can be absent in most asian beef dishes... The service was prompt and my food came lightening fast.

Great service and food was amazing. I got the Mongolian beef lunch special. The portion was enormous and I took half of it with me (cold Chinese food makes a great snack.) The Mongolian beef was perfectly spicy. The hot and sour soup was delicious as well... And they gave me a free refill on it too. My drink was never more than halfway empty and I felt like I was being treated like a king. I will definitely be going back.

There is an inherent dilemma that affects all ethnic cuisine in this country. That dilemma is: How authentic are we going to make this restaurant? Basically, this question is answered by looking at the bottom line. If you are in an area with a relatively low conentration of that ethnicity then in order for your business to stay alive, you need to cater to the tastes of the local majority. The beauty of China Chili is that they walk this line and do it successfully. Restaurants that lean towards authenticity typically tend to alienate the majority of people because its simply intimidating. On the other side, a restaurant that caters to American tastes is hated on for the watered down ethnic experience. What China Chili has managed to do is make Chinese food accessible to the demographic around them. The Asian population in the Phoenix metro area is concentrated in the East Valley and Northwest Valley. There are very few Chinese downtown and that is shown by the lack of Chinese restaurants in the downtown area. China Chili has understood this and has beautifully adapted their menu to reflect the area they are in. In response to the people who commented on the lack of authenticity of the food here, I would say that I agree with that in part. However, being Chinese, I know that if you go into any Chinese restaurant that has Chinese people working there and you ask them, you'll find that there are additional items that the kitchen can make for people who are looking for that authentic experience. China Chili is no different. Just ask for something more authentic and in most cases they can tell you what they have available. I can tell you from first hand experience that they have ALL Chinese cooks in the kitchen. Its not like they don't know how to make authentic Chinese food, but like any good restaurant, they know their audience. 

Now to the food. Most of the things on the menu are pretty tasty. One thing that they do that most other places don't is tailor the food to your exact specifications. They can make it spicy, or less spicy, or omit veggies, msg, meat, or add basically anything you want. Some favorites of mines are the House Special Chicken, Salt and Pepper Pork Chops, Chicken Corn Chowder, and Spicy Garlic Eggplant. During lunch, they serve hearty lunch specials that after make you wish you were going to nap time rather than work(to some that may be synonymous). They have even more dishes that they can make for lunch specials than the ones they have listed so make sure you ask. 

As for the decor....lets be honest. Chinese decor is tacky. I'm Chinese, I admit it. If the decor of a restaurant causes you to not eat there, then sadly you have probably missed the most amazing meals of your life because some of the biggest holes create some of the tastiest food. Its not dirty or messy, its just tacky, so please get over it. The Chinese are prone to gaudy, extravagant presentations, or did you miss the opening ceremonies of the Olympics?

In any case, I love China Chili because it allows people who would never walk into a more authentic Chinese restaurant to put a foot in the door of an enormous culinary world. And at China Chili they can venture in as far as they would want. .

Never disappointed when I order from here! Their house chicken is my absolute favorite food to order. The staff is very nice and even give you forks, plates, lots of soy sauce, and whatever else you could possibly want!

It's unfortunate that they won't deliver, but that's okay. It's worth the trip! Best Chinese restaurant in Phoenix, in my opinion!

Yummy!! We got the house special and orange chicken and seriously, it was good. Big thick white meat slices, very impressed. They give u an option of the degree of heat, we got medium. It was good, but if I go when someone that likes a bit of heat, def going for hot! Orange chicken sauce isn't your typical orange panda express flavour, so don't go in expecting that, it has a hint of brown sugar as well as the smell of it. I love jasmine rice and really liked that they served that. Will def be back to try other items on the menu

The. Food is good and it comes out fast. The issue I have is I feel rushed by the employees walking around. They seem to walk by a lot and stare at the plates to see if your close to be done w/ your food. Great at 1st trek refills after that your forgotten. Caught one waitress staring at me that made me very uncomfortable... But again the food is good though...

This place has the oiliest food I've ever eaten in my life.  I had carry out one evening (two dishes) and the entrees were soaked in oil.  I had to rinse with water my eggplant dish three times just to eat it without feeling sick to my stomach.  I wish I could've washed the other dish too (but it wasn't one that could be washed--it was a wide-rice noodle dish).

Can definitely taste the MSG in these dishes too.

Really not sure what the fuss is about.

If you live in central Phoenix and need chinese food, this is a good place to go.  It is a huge restaurant that serves all the normal chinese dishes.  I had the mogolian chicken and added broccoli.  I could have done without all the scallions and onions and would have liked more chicken.  The dish was good and I will probably go back again.

This is one of my family's favorite restaurants to go to for dinner and I definitely agree.

All of the dishes are always fresh and delicious. I especially love the green beans with tofu. It's extremely authentic and not many places have a spicy garlic sauce that can compare to the taste of this one.

If you like quality Chinese, check this place out.
Went with family tonight and a lot bang for the buck. Prices are really reasonable for dinner menu and the food was amazing. Definitely will come back.

I have no idea why this place is so highly rated. The service was poor and neglectful, it was during lunch but the place was not full and we had a time line to keep being on lunch ourselves. We were seated promptly and drink order taken, when returning with drinks placed them down and quickly left without a word. Sat for 10 minutes and flagged someone for an order. Soup for the lunch specials came out after the food, wasn't good. The Mongolian Beef I ordered was a plate of onions with approx 2 oz of beef. My boyfriend ordered House Special Chicken which has always been at every restaurant I have ever been to a crispy chicken in a brown broth heavy on ginger, onion and garlic...not here. I don't know what it was but it was awful. Corn starch thickened red sauce that was sour and spicy, blunt flavor without dimension and honestly inedible. We sat for some time trying to get attention of anyone to get a bill, was ignored. Finally got a bill and the person dropped it and left never to return or point us to the bar which is where you pay but never having been there and not being directed we didn't know. I am a skilled home cook and I make better than this on a Tuesday night, for $17.89 I could have actually eaten my food at home instead of leaving 2 full plates behind.

Downtown, want a fast sit down Chinese lunch with a large portion this is an option.

The menu is pretty standard item wise. Lunch includes soup a spring roll and white rice. lunches range from 6.95-8.95 plus drink. $1 more for fried rice or brown which seems a bit steep to me.

I had the ma po to fu. To fu in a "spicy" sauce with a few veggies. They oped to use a soft tofu making this into almost a soup like dish, firmer is almost allays better with tofu. I asked for mine very spicy and I still had to add allot of chili paste.

What I don't get is the interior decorations. It seems to be a mix of pseudo 80's night club meets china. 

It is nice that you can get your own bill making paying or a large work lunch a breeze

If only the food were better.

Have been coming here for years and has not had any bad experience. It is not fancy, just real good Chinese food. 
Walnut shrimp, chicken corn chowder, garlic eggplant, peppered pork, walnut shrimp, and a couple of other Chinese American staples.  No frills, not fancy, just classically good Chinese food.

This place was delicious. It's what I think of when I remember the chinese food places my mom and dad used to talk us to growing up in the phoenix area. Recently it seems like most of the places are super run down, the service is mediocre, and the products used in the food are down right embarrassing, well China Chilli DELIVERS! Their food was great (Veggie Lo-Main, Spicy Garlic Prawns *i dont know if this is exact name*, and the Fried Tofu special with jalapenos which wasn't bad for somebody who doesnt like Tofu) and the service was above average. The tell tale sign of this place was two things before I ate the food, how clean it was inside (and kinda chinese cheesy) and the parking lot was full when I drove by and when I came back to eat in addition to that there was a constant flow of people ordering take out. If you are in the mood for chinese take-out or to pop in for a quick bite, I would definitely recommend this over any other place around Cen-Pho that I've come across.

I recently started working really close to this restaurant and came for the first time about a month ago. I now order take out for lunch once a week or once every two weeks. It's really tasty, fast & my order is always accurate (have never had any problems with take out orders). My favorite dish is the Kung Pao Shrimp. It's very good! I'd recommend this to anyone in the neighborhood

We have ordered via delivery service several times and love all the main dishes.  Their friend rice isn't too salty or soaked in soy sauce like some places. The house lo mein and pepper calamari are both so addicting. Flavoring is great and not too greasy. We love that they poke ventilation holes into the fried items so they stay crispy.  Their soups however have been a little meh. Tried hot and sour and egg drop and neither really lived up to the rest of the menu. This is one of our favorite places!

Let start of saying I used to live in Beijing and chengdu for 10 years so I feel I know Chinese food very well. This is not the food they eat in China, But it is delicious American Chinese food! I read a lot of of the reviews here on yelp. All were pretty much spot on. The pot stickers we really great. Huge and crispy on one side. We came because of the check please review this weekend of this place. We knew from that that we should try the Orange chicken. Very good. The sauce was just right,  not to thick not to thin. We also had the Sichuan green beans. Good but we have had far better at the really authentic Sichuan resturant in Phoenix at the Sechwan Palace at the chinese cultural center. We also had the Mongolian beef that a another yelper had suggested. The best dish we had. Finally we had the veggie fried rice. I thought it was ok but my wife thought it was not good.
Not the best, not the worst. But the way I am feeling incredibly am pretty sure there was MSG somewhere. The wait staff were minimally attentive.
Never disappoints , the Pork fried rice and orange chicken are on point! Clean atmosphere and the few times I've gone to get take out, the staff seems to remember everyone's name and story.
Salt n pepper pork was DELICIOUS! Clean dining room, Very attentive service and people kept coming in.
China Chili is pretty decent on the side of american chinese food. Hubby and I went around 8:30p and ordered, good service, delicious food. If we happen to be in the area , will def go eat again!
The food was amazing. I am worried that I live too close and will get too fat based on this.
I have never ever had a bad meal here! The spicy garlic eggplant is to DIE for!!! Love it! The potstickers are yummy as well!
Love this place! Fast, fresh, delectable! Great location. Actually this truly is one of the best Chinese we have in the valley.... Very reasonable as well.

I ordered their House Chicken dish and found it HOT other than that no other flavors. I took it home and added some veggies and sweetness with some pineapple. Shouldn't have to remake the "House" recipe. 
The chicken was also disappointing, sliced very thin and rubbery.

Probably the best Chinese that I have had in the valley. Prompt service. Vast menu. Eat in or take out. On busy nights, finding parking can be an issue and like every other Chinese spot in the Valley, THEY DON'T HAVE DUCK SAUCE! WTF?!?! Duck sauce must be an East Coast thing...

OMG first time coming here and it won't be the last. Everything was delicious from the magnolian chicken to the vegetable fried rice, the steam pot stickers and the vegetable spring rolls. The service was amazing the food was plentiful.. you can definitely taste the love. Amazingly awesome!!!!!
Great food , had the fried pork chop with jalapeño and was very tasty !! Also tried the pot stickers , Hugh and loved them .. Definitely will return !

China Chili is one of those places you visit when you want something you know you'll like and need to get in and out really quickly.  I started working on Central and Indian School just around the time China Chili closed prior to the lightrail construction, so my first experience was at the new place.  I wish had gotten the opportunity to eat at the original location just to see if the experience was any better.

I have ordered two things at China Chili: the orange chicken and the sesame chicken.  I only order the former now.  I have never had to wait longer than five minutes for an order.  This is good yet slightly unnerving.  It makes me feel as though everything is ready-to-serve in the back, even though the freshness and temperature of the food says otherwise.  The orange chicken is out of this world.  An entire breast fillet is battered, deep-fried, sliced, and covered with a really delicious orange sauce.  If you ask for it extra spicy, be prepared to feel your face melt off.  The consistency of the heat level is a bit hit-or-miss, but when they get it right, you'll be simultaneously pleased and in pain.

My biggest beef with this place is the wait staff.  Very rarely is service pleasant.  Most of the waitresses are brusque and a bit too efficient for my liking.  When the dining room isn't full, they tend to huddle up near the kitchen and watch the patrons as they eat, usually talking quietly amongst themselves.  It is quite unsettling and makes me feel as though I'm not welcome.  The one exception is one of the very sweet older women who reminds me a bit of my grandma in that she always has a smile and is always so quick to ask if I need a refill.  I don't know her name, but I always hope she's there when I go.

So, visit China Chili when you're in a hurry and craving the best darn orange chicken you'll ever have.  Also, beware of really terrible parking options.

Some girl I know said she went to China Chili and it was the best Chinese food she's ever had. After she told me that I went to China Chili the next day. The menu is standard for a Chinese restaurant nothing special. We ordered some beef dish for our meal and a side of chow mein. The beef was chewy and the chow mein was bland. I do not understand why people love China Chili. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy!

Go there for lunch about twice a week.  Portions are great and the service is very good too.  Their food is also very good and different in some cases where I've been pleasantly surprised.  Will continue going there and will recommend.

oh no no no no!  i ordered the tofu and um, well, it was silken tofu.  i would figure that they would know which tofu to use and how to cook it but i was so unhappy with my meal.  i will never return and i would just like to forget about the whole thing.

We came here on a Saturday night.  We were sat quickly and efficiently.  We had great service, great food and great service.  

Yes I said service twice because man the wait staff is attentive and kind.  They serve the first round of the food to you and made sure our drinks were topped off.   

The food is excellent and high quality.  The menu has a lot of variety.  It was a great dinner.  

Only four stars because this was our first visit.  I am sure this will go to five stars soon as we will be back.

This is the Best Chinese place in town. I used to live 3 miles away and would order Take Out often. I have since moved to North Phoenix and STILL make the drive for Take Out...it is THAT GOOD. I recommend the Salt and Pepper Shrimp ( I eat that as an appetizer) and the Hong Kong Crispy Noodles...YUM. Service is Fast and Friendly.

Went here today for lunch with my coworkers and this place exceeded my expectations! They are. Dry quick to take your order and the food comes out really quick, which is great when you have an hour lunch. I order the house chicken lunch special which comes with soup, egg roll, and white rice. The chicken is REAL! It's very yummy and the rice was cooked to perfection. I definitely plan on coming back. I see why people would complain about the service but honestly I rather them get my order right and be quick.

In a town where Mexican joints outnumber their Chinese counterparts by like 50 to 1, you've got to find those rare oriental gems and keep them close.  China Chili wears the crown in the relatively uncrowded field of Chinese entrants.  

Take a group of friends and order 5 or different dishes to sample, just make sure that one of them is the Honey Walnut Prawns.  A good Chinese meal to ensure that your palette gets the much needed diversity that it deserves.
Food is fantastic as usual. Sometimes the service can be a little slow but it is always worth the wait.
Great food! But the best part is the service! Drinks stay full and the servers are happy and quick. Lunch special is a good bargain. I got House Special chicken and very much enjoyed it.

Just not good

Today my lunch companion and I were  in the mood for Chinese cuisine so we thought we would give China Chile a try. It has been a long time since I last visited China Chile.  I realized China Chile receives many positive reviews but to be honest, it just wasn't good, in my opinion. Maybe I caught them on an off day.

The service is very rushed at China Chile.  We barely sat down and glanced over the menu when the waitress came over, very ready to jot down our order. So we choose our entrees, Orange Chicken, and refreshments.

Pior to our entrees we were given a complimentary bowl of sweet and sour soup, however I just didn't like the taste. The portion sizes at China Chile are large, but the taste of the of the orange chicken was too sweet, salty, and the liberal usage of corn starch everywhere, made for an unpleasant taste and  both our dishes were smothered in sweet & sour sauce, the entrees just weren't good.

Having tried China Chile on several occasions, I have always been disappointed.

easily one of the best places for Chinese food in the central Phoenix area. the food is flavorful and the portions are gigantic!

China Chili's orange chicken has become my baseline for how orange chicken should taste; the sauce has the perfect balance between the sweetness of the oranges and the heat from the chili peppers. Soooo delicious! Also try the salt and pepper chicken.

The service is quick and friendly, you seriously cannot go wrong with this place.

BEST CHINESE FOOD IN PHOENIX! I am completely obsessed with this place. The boiled wontons are my absolute favorite! We've also had the noodles and Mongolian beef and everything was beyond delicious! I will go back time and time again!

Best Chinese food we have found in AZ.  We live about 25 minutes away and do not hesitate to drive here anytime we want Chinese.  We don't even try places closer to us anymore.  I have not had anything bad here, but our favorites are the hot & sour soup (we get it without shrimp because my husband doesn't like seafood), Szechaun green beans, beef fried rice, hot and spicy Szechaun prawns (you have to try these if you like shrimp), and the holy grail, the salt and pepper chicken.  I dream about it. Really good food here, always a good crowd but still fast efficient service, and they get your order right.

I live downtown and always WANT to love downtown businesses. I'm also aware of China Chili's status as a downtown institution. But the truth is that I've eaten here 3 times, and 2 of those times the food made me literally sick. 

Needless to say, a .333 batting average where "eating without getting sick" is what counts for a hit is not particularly impressive. And unfortunately, when I checked the County website to give a fair review regarding their cleanliness record, their entire history is no longer available since they moved to their new location. So I have nothing to report to you, folks, other than I've only eaten here 3 times and my Darwinistic instincts will not allow me to go back.

EDIT to add: I don't want to speculate about something that would harm a restaurant without solid proof. But my reaction to the food here is eerily similar to how I would feel after ingesting MSG. No scientific basis for me to say that. But that's what my gut tells me.
Can't understand the rave reviews, as this is the worst 'chinese' food I've ever encountered.  Most of the entrees are full of zucchini as a filler.   Everything tastes the same.

As this is the first time here, I am quite satisfied with everything we had. Egg foo yon,  orange chicken, house chow mein, and egg drop soup. Prices were excellent..... Now that we have been back several times to eat here, I would recommend this place (and have) to anyone. We always come home with boxes and boxes of food for the next day.
Very good food. Beautiful ambience. I honestly wasn't expecting such a nice place considering the location. Will be going back.

China Chili is not only a 4, it is a very solid 4. I was on my way back to the West Valley, from the East Valley, and did a search on my beloved Yelp for a highly rated Chinese Food joint that was on the way. China Chili kept appearing. We called in the take out order, and it was finished before I arrived. 

We ordered the House Chicken, Spicy Garlic Eggplant, Kung Pao Chicken, Mongolian Beef, and Fried Shrimp. And... BAM! It was bomb!

The House Chicken was delicious. Garlic-y, with little bit of spicyness to it, and a very subtle nuttyness to it from the oil in the wok. Great texture, great smell... It was fantastic.

I'm not an Eggplant fan, but my gf is, and she ordered it. She said the Eggplant was a 3.5. Good, but not the best she'd ever had.   

The Kung Pao... Again, a very good dish. If there was a complaint, it was that it was a tad heavy on the zucchini in the dish, which was just a tad overcooked. It changed the texture in the dish in an obvious way.

Mongolian Beef. NOM NOM! Perfect. Great flavor, great texture. Very happy with the dish. 

The Breaded Shrimp was perfect. I can only handle so much fried shrimp. Tried one, and it was spot on. 

This was a perfect way to end a 15 hour day.

This has to be one of my favorite Chinese places in town.. they make some very special dishes that I just crave!!!

Boiled Wantons
Salt and Pepper Shrimp
Orange Chicken

Ive had other things but for me these dishes are just bursting with flavor! Plus the service is great! They seem genuinely happy to see us when we show up!

Food is typical of Phoenix Chinese food, very boring. After everything I'd heard of the place, I was expecting alot more.  Was hoping for  along the lines of San Fran, or NYC, , but no such luck. Will not be back. I agree that portions were big and food was delivered fast, but doesn't make a difference if the food isn't good.
Always good! ...Portions are big! ...Great spacious place, lots of tables. ...Always a reliable place for some good Chinese Food!  ;P

This Chinese restaurant provides ordinary, average, middle of the road cuisine. The dishes ordered such as Orange Chicken, Shrimp Fried Rice, Sizzling Beef, and Pork Dumplings did not amaze. This is simply a place where you can come and get full on large portions of food. If you're looking to pack on some weight gains the over sugared sauces in every dish will help you! Nothing about this meal experience was memorable. People with higher standards when it comes to Asian Entrees prepare to disappointed! I had to take stars away also because of China Chili's lack of cleanliness.
Always fast and tastes great.  The only down side is they do not Deliver themselves, but you can use Postmates to get your food delivered.  FL-z31f if you want $50 in free delivery credits too!

This was our first time to China Chili and it was a great experience. We had a family style dinner for 4 people and it was more than we could eat. All the dishes were outstanding and I would recommend the restaurant for the authentic Chinese food. 

The service was great and everyone were really friendly. Two of our party had been there several times and the staff remembered them by name. Just a great day with friends and great food.

Their food is delicious! They have both good authentic Chinese food and Americanized food, so there's something for everyone! Great service! The owners are so nice and charming! Go there! :)

Did I mention the service there is composed of probably the sweetest waitresses and servers that you will ever find in all of Phoenix? Plus, FAST FAST FAST! :) Love it.

Not ordinarily a fan of Chinese food, I am a fan of China Chili! 

For $10 (and that's with a soft drink) the lunch special portions are huge (like enough to get a box and take home leftovers, huge!) and the Mongolian beef  is an option. 

Service is wham-bam-thank-you-ma'am but that works for a weekday lunch at a place that's 6 miles from the office.

Enjoyed dinner here with the family a few weeks back and service had a much more enjoyable pace.

Food has been consistently tasty. I like the batter they use for items like the lemon and orange chicken, etc. and the meat quality is good (i.e. all white meat chicken). 

This place could get me craving Chinese and that's an accomplishment!

The food is really tasty here.  The decor is like a Chinese version of an old folks home, so I wouldn't say the ambiance is special or even nice.  My daughter's chicken fried rice was delicious and my sweet and sour pork was very good.

The wait staff was not that friendly but that may have been a language barrier--which we like when eating at a Chinese restaurant.  The price was particularly good as our meal cost $25 for two which included a $8 glass of wine.

I was dissatisfied with this place after reading all the rave reviews. We ordered for 3. Pork fried rice, lemon chicken, and sweet and sour chicken.

Pork fried rice was way over-cooked. Chewy flavorless pork and little rice rocks were in abundance. It really had no flavor at all. It is hard to mess up this dish, but somehow, they did. 

Sweet and sour chicken. When you open the container and the veg is burnt, we have a problem. Hard over battered and over fried pieces of dry chicken were placed strategicly throughout the box. The sauce... well its sauce alright. Ketchup based. Thick. Gooey. Snot like sauce.

Lemon chicken was ok. Not great, but not bad either. Good bits of chicken. Ok flavor. Sauce was so so. Overall the best of the 3.

Recommendations... go to Mu Shu instead. See the owner there. His name is Gary, he will give you real food. Eat it and be happy. Without the (insert pun here) afterwards.

Thankfully I'm not one of those individuals that are effected by the addition of MSG. Therefore I can enjoy my periodic visit to China Chili with no adverse reactions. 

Quite a bit has already been covered on the expansive room, so I won't dive in to that. And most of my favorite dishes have already been covered in other's reviews so here are the ones that stand out in my mind (that haven't already been described at great length):
* Chicken Corn Chowder - one of my favorite "I'm sick" meals. Think egg flower with minced chicken and corn.
* Honey Walnut Prawns - not quite as good as Big Wongs, but damn good!
* Pillow Chicken - minced chicken with a bunch of other crunchy good things, fried up mouth-sized dumpling style and blanketed in black pepper sauce -  yummo! 
*Sichuan Style Green Beans - the menu version is made with pork, but I have them make it vegetarian with extra spice and IT IS TO DIE FOR.

I've never actually experienced the "frozen vegetables" that others have suffered, so I have to think that this is more anomaly than practice. They are always willing to alter dishes to my liking (more spice, no meat, different meat, etc.) - this is a HUGE plus in my book because I love spicy Chinese. The staff is Stevia sweet - meaning they are all naturally friendly! And drum role please.... I can call in my order, hop in the car, pick up my food, and get my chopsticks on in front of my own TV within 15 minutes! LOVE IT!!

Definitely my new go-to hole in the wall. Great food, huge heaping portions, and a menu that is more a novel than anything else. Decor is a bit dated but who cares. Don't go here for date night. Go there for some of the best comfort chinese food in the phx area.

Can't say this is the most authentic Chinese fare around.  It is however, dependable and tasty.  The lunch menu comes out in a flash, (parking is horrible) but you can actually get in and out within 40 minutes if you have to.  Dinner again is good, nothing mind blowing but worth a try.  Get a mix of the regular dishes and then try out the less ordered stuff  (i.e. they actually do have a secret menu in Chinese, just point and order if you have to)

Very surprised by the current rating of this spot (4 stars).  People always raved to me how amazing and authentic this place was.  After living in Phoenix for 2 years - I finally gave it a try.

Space - pleasantly surprised.

Food - My mom wondered aloud why she would be served dog food bc she's a person too

Wont go back.  

Go to New Hong Kong or Szechuan Palace or Panda Express or PF Changs for better asian food.

Best Chinese food in Phoenix.  I've been going to China Chili since it's original location on Central and Osborn and followed it like many of its fans to its much larger location which accommodates all of its patrons.

I don't usually bother writing reviews for places that have over 50 reviews but after reading some of the reviews, I want to set things straight.

First of all, I've been to the Chinese Cultural Center and am not a fan whatsoever.  China Chili blows the Cultural Center out of the water.

The beauty of China Chili (and only you regulars know this), they will make everything made-to-order.  In other words, if you want white meat only, with just light sauce and medium spice, they will do it just like that and deliver it steaming hot to your table within 5 minutes.  

The wait staff, if you get to know them, are extremely nice, kind and so sweet.  They may not be too chatty but don't take it personal. 

So next time, if you want your Chinese food in a certain way, just ask.  They will give you exactly what you want.

I went with two friends to China Chili for lunch this afternoon. It was very meh. I had the chicken salad (chicken breast, lettuce, cilantro with hot mustard and sesame oil) and a side of white rice. It was very bland. If it had hot mustard and sesame oil on it, I totally missed it. The rice wasn't cooked well at all...seriously, WTF? The soup that came out beforehand was nothing to write home about. My two dining companions had the tofu and said it was not very filling at all and that is was just OK.  

The lunch menu is not very large and to me seems to be quite lacking in some staple Chinese dishes that you would expect. The prices were pretty standard for a Chinese restaurant. Thankfully service was fast and pleasant.

I'd heard a lot of good things about China Chili, and decided it was time we checked it out.
Now the setting is great. Beautiful inside, the server was friendly, but the food itself was very average and a little overpriced. I wanted to give this place a 5-star review, but I feel like I'd be lying to myself and anyone reading this. Perhaps I'll try it again during their lunch special, and not feel like it wasn't worth the money spent.

So my first experience here was not so hot. The dishes we ordered were pretty bland (all needed a generous amount of soy sauce). The one thing I did enjoy were the pot-stickers and the yummy dipping sauce. I ended up pouring that pure yummyness all over my main entree. To tell you the truth, I was hesitant on trying this place again until I took a peek at some reviews and found people had lots of good things to say about the place.

So i gave it another shot. The atmosphere in this place is like sitting in large asian shoe box, it's one big dining room, yet it's not off-putting. It's strangely welcoming. You feel like your family with everyone else eating there. I went on a Saturday night and I was surprised to see so many old people. I'm all "this place has to be good if the older crowd is here". The  psychedelic plastic lighting fixtures cycling through all the colors of the rainbow makes me laugh but I love it. The service is quick and attentive, however when we tried to order a Mountain Dew and Dr. Pepper, the small asian woman had no idea what we were talking about and blurted out something I could not make out. I heard "Coke" in the jumble of words and just said "yes". They work as a team there which makes for some speedy service. We ordered a few appetizers: Pot-Stickers and Crab  Puffs. The Pot Stickers were good but the Crab Puffs were not. The inside lacked any crab at all and had a runny constancy that quite frankly, surprised me. Eww. Avoid these. I remember reading a review from Alexander C. suggesting the Orange Chicken. What a great choice! The dish made up for the runny crab puffs. The meat was top notch; moist with no grizzly chunks like a lot of places have. The sauce was bursting with flavor and had just the right amount of heat to it. I highly recommend this dish.

China Chili...glad I gave it another shot :)

update on the chinese chicken salad: you can order it WITHOUT breading!
i like to get this to-go, with extra lettuce (or i add extra at home) and dressing on the side... i add an avocado to it and BAM! instant heaven salad.

China Chili always has good Chinese food for when I'm in need of it. I love the fact that they also do catering, and I was able to cater a big party and they made accommodations to substitute two dishes that were not on their catering menu. It was a huge hit, and everyone loved it. I've also ordered takeout a few times now from them, and I've been satisfied every time. Their portions are pretty large. One dish plus a box of rice will last me three meals! Although the taste here is a little Americanized, I do like their chicken with black bean sauce. That is usually my go-to. The vegetables are very fresh, and the meats are always cooked well. When I order ahead for takeout, they have the food ready in about ten minutes. Even for catering, I think I only had to put in the order a day or two ahead. The staff here are usually pretty friendly too.

People... the Peking Duck. 

I went here once for a lunch and was not particularly impressed. Seemed like fairly run of the mill Chinese food. Then my girlfriend started telling me about how great Peking duck in NYC is, so I started on a quest to find it in Phoenix.

It's here.

To be fair, I had never had this dish before, so I don't have a lot to compare it to. But my then girlfriend (now fiancee, in no small part because she introduced me to Peking duck) has had it many times and we were both enthralled with the dish at China Chili. It's kind of a unique experience as well as your server will assemble what are essentially succulent duck tacos (duck slices wrapped in Mandarin pancakes) right at your table.

I'm not going full 5 stars because I haven't been particularly impressed with anything else here and the ambiance is nothing to get excited about, but the duck is most certainly a 5-start entree.
Love their food, very fast efficient service.

It's been hard to find decent Chinese food in Phoenix, but this is the exception with great food! The Hot and Sour Soup was super spicy, but really good.  Be sure and order the Orange Chicken, it was great.  Not the usual super deep fried chicken.  This was moist and the sauce was so tasty.  I look forward to returning and trying more dishes.
There aren't many options for Chinese food in Phoenix, but this is definitely the best.

I'm having a moment with China Chili. I kind of forgot it existed, and then I went there on Christmas day eve and was blown away! We shared orange chicken, mongolian beef, and chicken chow mein. Everything was so fresh and delicious, but I was specifically enchanted by the orange chicken. And the chow mein. Honestly, I couldn't stop eating it because it was so good! The chow mein is especially flavorful and addicting, I dream of it. I'm looking forward to coming here more often.
Food was average. Service was GREAT!... The only memorable thing was: Open on 12/25

Thank you David and Lisa S for introducing us to China Chli this past Friday night!

We're always on the lookout for good Chinese in the Valley, and now we have another option (not too far from home) with China Chili.  I didn't expect CC to be such a large restaurant, and they were hopping to boot!  The atmosphere was welcoming - casual and old school; I especially love the disco ball in the main dining room.  The servers are serious and efficient, perhaps because they don't speak much English, but with so many customers, it works out fine... I imagine most people are there for the food anyways.

So without further adieu, here's what we ordered for our family-style dinner:

-Pot Stickers (I didn't have these but everyone else did and enjoyed them!)
-Sizzling Rice Soup
-Honey Walnut Prawns
-Sichuan Style String Beans (we ordered with no pork and extra spicy thanks to a tip I found in Julie P's yelp review)
-House Chow Fun Noodles
-One of their house special steak dishes (I think it was Sizzling Black Pepper Beef in a dark sauce).

Yes, I know, that's a lot of food for four people but we did have plenty of leftovers and I liked everything that I ate!

Thank you -  (Xièxiè) - China Chili, David and Lisa, for a memorable meal!  I look forward to returning soon to try some of my other Chinese favorites!

What a nice change pf pace from all the others.  The restaurant is wide open with plenty of room.  Portion size was enormous - one side of pork fried rice could be enough for 4 adults.  Orange chicken was a-ok, a little heavy on the sauce.

4 stars for the price!

Good but not amazing. 

And, not terribly authentic, it seems. My exchange-student son said his Hong Kong-style noodles ($8.95) were not like he'd ever eaten in his home town (of Hong Kong), but he gobbled them up anyway. 

I though the menu was very diverse and appealing, but very pricey compared to other similar restaurants.

Service 5 stars, we were first timers and they rolled the red carpet out. We came for a late lunch and they gave us the lunch special prices. The Mongolian beef was excellent!!5/5 the Szechwan chicken 3/5. Came with lots of vegetables which was nice. Bottom line is we were impressed by their service with a smile,speed, and quality of food.
Too salty.. prices are reasonable but not worth it.. the quality is just not there..  too bad it's a really nice restaurant location.

Good location off your choice of major arterials. Parking isn't abundant but isn't bad for a near downtown restaurant. Spacious, neat and clean dining area with some window seating. 1:00 Saturday afternoon we were seated promptly and as hide bound water drinkers, we were given our drinks pronto. All the servers seem to work together so there are no time gaps. 

We looked over the menu and ordered a seafood soup, salty fish and chicken fried rice and Kung Pao seafood. The excellent seafood soup came first and fast. It was very tasty and was entirely consumed by the time our entrees showed up. The other two weren't bad but weren't great either. We ate our fill and took the remainder as carry out. Our server boxed and bagged it at the table. My opinions on the food are a matter of detail regarding fish not salty and squid overcooked...I've had both these dishes at other places and I'll stand with my opinion.

I think that with a few visits to identify  the cooks best talents, this  could be a fine neighborhood Chinese restaurant, worthy of regular patronage.

Good Chinese food! A friend recommended this place to us and coming from Flagstaff where there is no Chinese food, we were so happy to eat here. Attentive service, nice atmosphere, and very large portions. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Phoenix.
Great Chinese Food! Real Chicken served fresh unlike the double fried chicken you get at most places. Highly recommend.

I go here during my lunch break it is fast and easy. Prices are decent and the staff is always friendly. Anything you order turns out tasty. Only down side is it is salty so be prepared to drink a ton of water. And if you can split the lunch plate it's enough for two!

China Chili is my favorite Chinese Restaurant in Phoenix. They prepare their food the way you would at home without the typical mystery meat. The menu is full of lot's of choices. One of my favorites is the Honey Walnut Prawns. The Pillow Tofu is good even if you don't like Tofu. One of the Vegetable dishes (sides) that they are known for is their Spicy Garlic Eggplant.  The servings are large though, so consider sharing and getting a couple of items. The Chicken Salad is a great summer lunch dish. It is great to go. The managers are some of the nicest people you will meet.

I had an instant craving for some Chinese take-out and fortunately there were 15 minuets left before closing so I hit China Chili on the speed dial. I ordered the House Chow Mien which was ready just as I walked through the door. I could feel my food still sizzling through the Styrofoam to-go container. I couldn't get home fast enough and the smell from the back seat was so tempting I was close to pulling off to the side of the road and diving in. So I get home rip open the plastic bag to find my noddles steaming and filled with shrimp, pork, chicken, and scallions. This was one delicious meal (way better than Pei Wei) and the portion was huge for just under $9 bucks. I stuffed my face crazy and sill have enough for left overs or until I get hungry again in the next hour or so.
My comrades and I were craving good Chinese food and this place delivered! The Lovers Prawns dish was terrific!

I showed up here to meet a couple of coworkers for lunch.  We work in different buildings so we decided to get lunch outside for a Friday treat.  I got there and thought that the only parking they have is the 6 spaces out front.  I learned later you can park all along the side and back of the building.  HA!  

We walked in and was quickly greeted and seated.  3 seconds go by and a serve shows up ready to take our drink order.  She came back in like 30 seconds with the drinks.  And asked for our food order.  We were not ready and asked for a few mins.  She looked away from us and walked away.  She did not seem happy we were not ready.  =(  We quickly scanned the lunch menu and made our choices.  She was back in 3 mins. We ordered and she was happily on her way.  =)  

I got the house special chicken, I asked for not spicy (SORRY, I am a whimp).  It was tender white meat lightly battered & fried then covered in special garlic sauce and served with a egg roll.  It was a nice garlic sauce (not too garlicy to kill all your coworkers but just a good amount).  The chicken was completed cooked, tender, and juicy.  But before all that we got chicken corn soup, not bad at all.  Food was not too shabby!

Overall it was a quick lunch and taste good.  I am a full and happy camper.  Now back to work!!!

China Chili is a main stable for good reliable Chinese food.
Lunches here are affordable, fast with a great variety of Chinese specialities. Lunch hours are packed, best right after 1pm.  Dinners are also popular here with weekends being a time for a full house. Like most restaurants this place has some not to be missed dishes. The boiled wanton soup is so good! You must try the boiled wanton and its spicy, peanut goodness! This is great shared before your meal. The Honey Walnut Prawns here are amongst the best I've ever had. The orange chicken is overly fried, pick around the fried chicken and enjoy a mildly spicy orange sauce. The Mongolian Beef is also a favorite. The restaurant does use an abundant amount of onion scallions, I often ask to omit them. The staff here is generally very attentive and you can customize your dishes. Definitely worth a visit!

My friend and I ended up here by accident but I'm glad we stopped by!  Service is very attentive here, and we were quickly seated.  We ordered the cheese crab puffs and the potstickers.  I'd pass on the cheese puffs, they had a bizarre flavor, that I still can't put my finger on.  The pot stickers were perfect.  I ordered the pepper beef and it was very good.  The red and green peppers were cooked just perfectly so they were not too soft or crisp and the beef was also done just right with the perfect amount of pepper sauce.  It came with white rice, which I'm not use to, since I usually have brown, but that was fine also.  Decor is fine, a little 60's china-ish but it seems to suit the place.  From the diverse crowd that was there last night enjoying themselves, it seems they agree with me.  This place is a hit.

This place is on the way home from my yoga studio, and I had been wanting to try it for a while. The building looks small from the outside, but is rather large inside. 

Location: 3rd St and Flower. Parking is limited in front, and there's some in back but not a ton. 

Food: OK but not overly impressed. I guess I think my food was rather bland.  I got the vegetables with white sauce, which is not advertised as spicy but just had very little flavor. That said, the vegetables were cooked well and not too mushy and not too underdone either -just right!

Always solid. My kid's favorite for sit-down or take-out classics. We stopped here on Saturday afternoon with friends who had never been. My daughter had (as always) beef chow fun. Fat rice noodles, tons of scallions and onions. Just a big ol' plate of comfort food. Sweet & sour chicken for her friend, who loved it. We shared a delicious salt & pepper shrimp dish, some hot & sour soup and crispy that was as good as I've had anywhere. Bonus points to the server for taking the time to speak in Mandarin with my daughter's friend, who is 2 years into learning to speak the language.
Always FAST and Tasty!!! The staff are always great especially the young man that always waits on me. THANK YOU!!

This is my go to spot for Chinese food. It's always fresh and yummy. I typically get the orange chicken with rice. The chicken is white breast meat and not prepared the typical deep fried way. Also their soups are good. Everything is always great and super fast takeout!

First time sitting in China Chili and so glad that I did as I was able to get their fresh wonton soup. (Unfortunately I could not remember the name of the soup--thank goodness the table behind me was eating it and I was able to point it out the waitress) The wonton soup came with 8 large wontons, broccoli, chicken, green onions, and other Chinese vegetables in a savory white broth. The soup came out in a large bowl and was piping hot--almost burned my tongue a couple of times, but it was worth it as it was very flavorful and not too salty.The soup with tax came to $8, which was a surprise as I thought that it would be more for the size. I would definitely come back here for lunch as the price you pay for the amount of food that you get and the quality is great. The only negatives was the service (the waiters stood around not too far from our table looking extremely bored) and the chicken corn chowder soup, which was bland and left a lot to be desired. I only ate it because I was very hungry and had to wait 15 minutes for my friend to show up (smile)

I hadn't been to China Chili in about four years and a business trip had me staying right around the corner.  Something has changed big time!  The kung pao chicken was disappointing and the beef fried rice had a strange flavor.

ordered the mapo tofu and the hong kong style beef for takeout. the mapo tofu tasted like hot and spicy soup and the hong kong style beef only filled up half the takeout box for $13. overpriced Chinese food and only tasted mediocre at most. not coming back again
Food exceeded expectations. Waitress was quietly attentive. We are discerning Chinese diners and will definitely come back.  Spicy Hunan Tofu very nice!
Incredible food. Make sure to try their boiled wontons - delicious!

Being kind of picky about Chinese food, you will never get me to a Chinese restaurant where there isn't a single Chinese patron. That being said, the food here really is as good as everyone says. The ginger scallion lobster had a fantastic flavorful sauce. The salt and pepper chicken wings were fried to a nice light crisp with jalapeño and garlic flavor. The green beans were saucy and with kick of spice. Those were my least favorite since they didn't taste like Szechuan dry fried beans at all-- they were sweet and sour and very saucy, but I still enjoyed them. If I lived in Phoenix, this would be one of my go to spots for takeout.

We went to this place after an appointment at the VA and it's so good! The crowd is eclectic, the staff is fast and attentive, and the food is good and authentic. The lunch special is very reasonable, portions are great, they have bomb sweet and sour soup, and it's a very low key environment. It's not fancy, but that's charming.

I was craving Hong Kong style chow mein really bad so I busted my Yelp app and China Chili was one of the first on the list. We got to the restaurant and were seated promptly. 

Our order: crab puffs, salt and pepper shrimp and Hong Kong style chow mein. We first got our crab puffs and they were slim. Once I started eating them, there was practically no crab meat. For $6, what a rip! Then we get the chow mein and shrimp. The entrees weren't any better because they were bland, bland, bland! I was so disappointed. Service was practically non-existent and what we paid was definitely not worth it. I'm probably not going to come back anytime soon.

I needed to cater a lunch for an office meeting and decided to take a chance on China Chili even though they don't deliver. The lack of delivery option is really the only bad thing I can say about China Chili. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, my order was ready exactly when I asked for it to be, everyone at the meeting loved their various dishes, serving sizes were generous (especially for lunch specials), and the prices were very reasonable.  I was advised by my staff in no uncertain terms that we should cater with China Chili again, and I would certainly return on my own.
Large portions, fast take out service! I recommend the salt n pepper chicken and house special chicken. I'd stay away from egg rolls and soup though, didn't care for them

I have tried this place 4 times because its supposed to be good but each time the food has been less than mediocre.  Ive tried 4 different basic items from the lunch menu and they were all equally flavorless.

Great tasting food. Me and my wife were trying to find a great chinese restaurant that we could enjoy together since all the other ones we went to were not that great. We ordered Lemon Chicken with their chicken fried rice. Really big portions to share so we only needed one order of each! It was delicious!! The food got to us within 15minutes! Awesome atmosphere and nice service! Only problem is limited parking!

Walked out when I realized they put MSG in their food. :S
I have tasted their take out before at a family
Members house. It was delicious which is what brought me into the restaurant. But when I asked if they use MSG they said yes. Rather get of PF changs or pei Wei. Even Panda Express doesn't use msg. It's bad stuff.

Your food will arrive in less than two minutes!  Its almost magical.  My personal favorite is the orange chicken.  The chicken is very lightly breaded and the sauce is the perfect combination of sweet and spicy.  Delicious!  The one and only downside, the inevitable sodium-induced post-lunch coma.
All I can say is WOW!! This place is amazing. Everything is homemade and the real deal. It's so hard to find good Chinese food here in Arizona and this place is just awesome.

Love love love China Chili. We've been searching for a good Chinese food place for years ever since our old standby closed down and we've finally located a winner! My favorite is the Mongolian chicken, crab puffs, and fried rice. The service is prompt and the place is huge and comfortable. One of our new favorites!
Good food, fast service, and convenient location. This place is very busy, and parking can be a problem.

This is my favorite place in the whole on Phoenix metro!!! I come every chance I get! The staff are always very friendly and the service is lightening fast. Be sure to try the Boiled Wonton appetizer; a Pad Thai-esque broth with delicious pork dumplings boiled in it. A great way to start your meal! I hope this place is around for a long long time!
Place is always packed, food only  so so.  Had better.  Wife had mongolian chicken,  all onions
Ample open seating area, with generous proportions. We've gone as a group, ordered different plates and have just all shared everything. My go to is the Kung pap chicken and sizzling rice soup.

Standard American-ized Chinese food.
Will sub tofu for any meat of any dish.
Huge, HUGE menu.
Super fast service.
EXTREMELY strong cocktails.
My father and SO both openly love it.

Sold.

My first time at the China Chili on a trip up from Tucson.  I am a critical reviewer on Yelp--- but I can't find one criticism  for this place ( maybe clean their carpets). The food was all good-- We had fried rice-- the walnut shrimp- peeking duck and stir fried green beans-- with fried banana and ice cream at the end- 
All was piping hot and so so good-- and we will return

Came here for a Chinese style banquet:
Fish maw soup - decent
Crispy chicken - very good
Pepper beef - addictive
Peking pork - addictive 
Pea sprout - ok
Scallop with chinese broccoli - good
Halibut in sauce - good 
Service - pretty good

dear china chili
PLEASE for the love of god
bottle that orange chicken sauce
and sell it

keep making the best orange chicken 
i've ever had

don't think panda express orange chicken
this is on a whole other level or orange chicken
just an entire chicken breast
that is incredibly juicy and tender
lightly (very lightly) breaded and fried
with this incredible sauce
wish i was there right now

Been there a couple of times, but usually just for takeout as there is nothing better than laying in bed, eating Chinese, and watching a movie.  I was never totally impressed but it's the closest Chinese restaurant to my house and so I went back.  

Then one magical day I decided to dine in.  It was a momentous day indeed.  It was the day I discovered the trick to China Chili.  You see you need to go in.  Sit down.  Order way more than you are going to eat.  Munch a bit at the table.  Then get the rest wrapped up.  For some reason if you call in a to go order the food is not nearly as good.  

Favorites you ask?  Well, thanks for asking.  All time favorite is the pillow chicken.  It tastes just like foil chicken but is much larger with out the hassle of all the foil.  Next favorite?  Anything with scallops.  Seriously the cooks in the back must have a PhD in scallopology.  They are consistently cooked to perfection.    Last but not least is the egg foo young.  It's not on the menu but ask and ye shall receive.  

The only reason this place doesn't get a fifth star from me is the take-out.  Food is delicious and service is ridiculously good.  I wish I didn't have to play the games I do but will continue to do so to ensure great take-out.

The Orange Chicken is no joke. Breaded and fried perfectly, so that the breading accentuates the dish, doesn't detract from it. Wife got vegetable dish also very good, but get the Orange Chicken, will not disappoint. Sauce is worth getting by itself.

What can I say about China Chili that hasn't already been said in glowing write-ups in local magazines and the Arizona Republic? Probably not much. But, because you adore me, I'm going to throw in my opinion anyway. You're welcome.

I first encountered China Chili while it was still operating at it's doomed Central Avenue location. Of course it wasn't doomed due to bad food, lousy service or any other detriment other than the light rail project's existence. So, it moved. 

After about 9 months it's back and ready to serve some of the best Chinese food in town. I've yet to venture to the part of the menu that offers duck, but I've tried several beef, chicken and pork dishes and I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered.
