My current favorite is the orange beef. Slightly sweet and a bit spicy, it's cooked golden and crispy and makes my tongue extremely happy. 

The dining room is wide open. No booths. All tables. The volume can get a little loud when there are many patrons, and there usually... there are many patrons.  

One thing that sets them apart from other Chinese places I've tried is the way that some of the chicken dishes are prepared. Typically, little bites of chicken are battered, fried and covered in sauce. At China Chili, the entire cut of chicken is battered, THEN sliced and covered in sauce. This makes it visually more appealing and you aren't consuming so much batter and grease.

I'll be back many times in the future so I can get my Chili on.

Can't believe I haven't done a review for this place. So far nothing I've had in the valley compared. Coming from the Bay Area I have high standards for Asian food and this is so far my most favorite place to go. All the food has met and exceeded my expectations. Hot and sour is just right although I add extra vinegar and hot paste. Lol. Hunan beef is one of my favorite things to get even though it's not on the menu they make it for me. Eggplant is bomb and all the apps are yummy. I love the fact that you get refills on drinks too!! Prices are reasonable decor is ok but those things are secondary for me. Big seating area and prompt service with parking close to downtown keeps me coming back! You won't be disappointed I know I haven't!

So I heard this was the best Chinese place in Phoenix. I hope not. 

PROS: The staff is efficient. They are on point from entry to exit.

The place is very large and can accommodate tons of guests. I went after the lunch rush and there were just a handful of people in there.

The tallest soda cups. 

Quick Service. My food is was out in less than 5  minutes after ordering. 

I ordered the Orange Chicken. It's always good to try the popular dish at the new place to see how they prepare it.

Cons: It did not look very appeasing to the eye. It sorta looked just slopped together. Presentation is key with me.

WAAAAAYYYY too saucey! The chicken and rice were drowned in the sauce. I could not even finish it.

Maybe I need to try another dish or maybe just order the sauce on the side next time, but I'm still looking for the best Chinese food in Phoenix.

It's very hard to find decent Chinese food in Phoenix and this place is your standard fare. The house chicken and vegetable chow mein were very good as well as the vegetable spring roll. They're set up in what looks like a banquet hall which is a little weird at first but I do like how open it is. Definitely come with a group and order a few plates to share. We couldn't finish the two dishes between us - tons of left overs!
My favorite Chinese restaurant in Phoenix.  Love the calamari.  Lunch specials are great and cheap.

My review:

Please understand that I am a hard rater.  I rarely award more than 3 stars.  My definition of 3 stars is a good, solid meal with good service.  It is a place that I recommend you try and a place I will likely return to.  

The food here was tasty and the value for what you pay is within reason.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  Both made for a positive dining experience.

Today I began with a large bowl (enough for 4!) of chicken corn chowder.  I found it to be slightly bland.  Next was sweet and sour chicken and house fried rice.  Both good.

I was disappointed that they did not offer combination plates.  Everything was ala carte (Sat).

Take a chance and eat here.  I think you will enjoy it.  Tell them Chris S. from Yelp sent you.  They will have no idea who the hell I am but you may get a good laugh out of it!  Enjoy!

I ordered take out from China Chili, after leaving my choice for lunch up to Urbanspoon today. I mean, I'm really broke nowadays, and I regret when I spend the little money I do have on so-so food, and I kinda regret today... 

They offer lunch combos here, but today's side soup was something with pork in it, so I had to get something else. I ordered the Vegetable Chow Fun, and it had no flavor to it what so ever. I'm serious, just nothing. The vegetables tasted ok, the rice noodles we're ok. but mostly this was just a bland dish. I have put the remainders of it in the refrigerator in hopes it will taste better tomorrow. 

The staff was courteous and pointed me to the takeout desk. While I was waiting for my food, which wasn't long it was done pretty quickly, I took a good look at the place. It looked for the most part to be clean and reminded me of the halls that people rent out for those 20K budget weddings. Many family style tables and flat screens on the walls, with "Chinese" decorations scattered in between. Wait, did I see pseudochandeliers with multicolored lights? I think I did...

If i could give China Chili less than one star, I would.

Friends keep dragging me there because it is walking distance from their offices.  If they keep insisting on China Chili, i might have to show up too late to get lunch. I have never had a good meal there. The worst was mushu that tasted like the vegetables in it were canned.

A good restaurant for a nice family dinner. My friend had the seafood duck dish and I had the spicy pepper chicken with garlic sauce and brown rice. We shared hot and sour soup. 

My friend liked The duck seafood dish. I also liked my chicken pepper dish but for me it was too greasy and too much sauce. The soup was good and we both liked it. I'd definitely recommend coming here as it's nice, quiet and service is good and fast.

Yum. Great place to be a regular. All the hot tea you can drink, fresh and homemade dishes. The Salt and Pepper Calamari is unbelievable! Seriously, one of the best dishes in Phoenix....salty, spicy, rich. My #1 pick for local Chinese food
I like Chinese food! The Waiter was patient and friendly, what's more, the dishes are so delicious. My friend ordered a piece of Set meal named Phoenix with me. Wonderful!

So ill start off by saying the food here is good but nothing spectacular. But for me what makes this place somewhere I go back consistently is that the service here is so quick that i can eat there within my 30 minutes i get for my work.
The best Chinese restaurant in Phoenix. You can never go wrong with China Chili. Also they are open christmas day! Great service dining in and great for take out.

I hate to be a Debbie Downer because clearly so many people love this place, but it's not for me. I have tried many times to like their food but I just can't! China Chili gets ordered regularly  in my office and every time I take a taste I am disappointed. Their fried rice is terrible. Not a single veggie or egg piece to be found. Chicken is rubbery and the sauces always tastes a little off.
This is my homey Chinese to-go spot. Whenever I don't want to cook, I called them and then picked it up.

If you want great food, fast service and good prices, make sure to come here. Lunch is fast and ready to go. Service is impeccable without being overbearing. It is a no frills, but clean place. Originally located on Central, it was moved to this big old building during the Light Rail construction. There are some amazing things that are not on the lunch menu but they serve when requested. Don't miss the Boiled Wontons. I go out of my way to eat here whenever possible, which isn't often enough.

SSSSSSS-boy is it hot at China Chili! And I don't mean because the AC has gone on the fritz. It's because China Chili frequently lives up to its name as one of the hottest Chinese eateries in town!!

The old Central Avenue hangout was forced to move due to Light Rail [hisss] but that' OK because it all ended up for the best--they're now in a lot bigger building on 3rd Street! Which means that you can get in for some great food much faster than ever.

The service is fast, the food is above average Asian fare, those who love hot n' spicy Chinese are in luck too--they have plenty of hot stuff here. 

You may even see Her Honor the Guv here, I have it on good authority that this is one of her favorite dives--oops, I meant restraurants [it's not REALLY a dive any more since they moved to the new digs].

I read all the great reviews from China Chili and I hate to say it, but I disagree with many of them. I think one of the biggest things to consider is how many different styles of Asian cuisine there are. Maybe I just don't like this type of Chinese food?? The dishes I have tried have varied anywhere from their house special chicken to the their Mongolian beef and their deep fried prawns. Every dish I have had from here have been made with good quality ingredients and have been prepared nicely but to me the flavor just isn't there. My fiancée really likes their food however, which is the reason I've eaten it on several different occasions. If I do order from here, I typically get the Pillow Chicken which is good and had a really interesting (in a good way) texture. I love a good hot and sour soup, and again their soup just doesn't quite do it for me for some reason. The service here has always been good, take out has been fast and efficient, and the lot is seemingly always packed. So on this one, I'll just chalk it up to personal taste, which is just a confirmation that everyone is different - which is fine with me.

I just love this place. Have been coming for years but not very regularly. I'm never disappointed. Great selection of dinners, nice portions, and real moist and plump chicken. Got n sour soup is outstanding. Need to come back now often.

I like china Chili..

Definitely would come back. I always end up going here maybe 1 every two months. I like specific dishes they have here. Chicken Salad  and Salt and Peppered pork. definitely order those if i come...mostly because it is a craving. I can't turn down jalapenos. :)

China chili is about a mile up the street from where I live. The food is pretty good and the service is great as well. This is a sit down Chinese restaurant type of place. Food price is average but you get a lot of good for the buck. I have been here a few times and I would recommend this place.

The orange chicken and house rice were perfect together.  We added in a pork dish and it was a great combo.  They seated us quickly and had our drinks out right away.  The server checked on us consistently but wasn't annoying!

I was told this is some of the best Chinese food in Phoenix. It doesn't really compare to what you can find in LA, but for Phoenix, it's a definitely thumbs up. My favorite dish here was probably the least Chinese dish of all - chicken salad. I'd get that again for sure - in Phoenix or LA!

OMG!!! I love China Chili. This place is perfect. Great food, timely fashion and clean. Super great service. A must try if you're in the down town area. Simply amazing. I cannot say enough great things about this establishment.

I'm only half Asian so I'm not sure if my opinion counts. tho the price is cheap and the service is lightning fast the food does not stack up.  yet the place was packed.  

There was enough oil on my food for me to deep fry my thanksgiving turkey, luckily it was not peanut oil otherwise i would have ask for a to go box.

I swear. Some friends never steer me wrong when it comes to deliciousness. 

I was told the house special chicken is the thing to try at China Chili. However, after looking at the menu, and discovering an item by the name of pillow chicken that included the phrase "pillow shaped morsels" how could I resist? There was none of that resistance crap. That food was in my belly fast! The pillow chicken was chicken mixed with onion, bamboo shoot and I believe something else and breaded into little pillow sized wonder. It was laid on top of steamed broccoli and then covered in a black pepper sauce. I wish it was spiced with something more than pepper, but other than that I have no complaints. It was so filling (in the good way, not the I'm gonna get sick way like most Chinese I have) I was only able to eat half. 

I loved the huge round tables in the center with the lazy susans. They reminded me of ones at a fantastic restaurant near where I grew up. The inside is really spacious and has some fantastic traditional decor. The menu was so large that I found several things I'd like to try next time including a whole section of chow fun food. Fun? Yep. I'd like some.

Downside? The parking lot is tiny and narrow. Parking in a space perfectly if there are cars on both sides of the spot is a feat I'd love to see mastered.

Now this is my joint, when I am looking for real , let me say it again, real Chinese food. I mean I want take out, I want fried shrimp and I want to walk away feeling like I just added enough food to my system to sleep through the winter , I come to this place. This is my number 1 Chinese take out place. Please do yourself a favor and just order from here. They actually fill your order with the items you want. You want a side of coconut shrimp , you will be eating more shrimp than bread trust me. If you get chicken lo trust me, you will get more meat in there than filler . love this place .

Food was horrible. I would never ever go there again. It was weired because we got our food served after like 2 minutes we ordered it. I'm not sure if they served us some leftover food because they did not have enough time to cook all the food we ordered in under 5 minutes. 
We got a fried rice, which was not too bad. But the orange chicken we got felt undercooked and the beef we got seemed overcooked. We returned the beef because it was not edible. Overall not a good experience

It was just ok for me. I went for lunch on 4/21/16 and ordered the kung pao shrimp. I asked for it to be extra spicy and only got two extra chili peppers. The egg roll was not great... The insides were soggy and not very tasty. I'll go back though, it's as good as it's probably going to get in Phoenix.

Got take out from here for the first time.  The parking situation is bad. Their lot is too small for venue size so you end up parking in a gravel lot behind the business behind the restaurant. The food is okay.  Pot stickers and spring rolls were good but at the end of the Hunan Chicken I wasn't as satisfied as I was hoping.  The flavors were not as deep and seasoned as I have had with this dish.

Second time here, and it was way better than the first time. Got the Spicy Orange Chicken and it was really good!

First review: Meh..I got the Sweet and Sour Prawns and I was unimpressed. All I could taste was the breading. But my friend got the Spicy Orange Chicken and he thought it was perfect. Another buddy got the Mongolian Beef, but it should be called Mongolian Onion because that's all there was on his plate. They are fast at lunch which is a plus.
Went for my third time its good, but my food was not as hot and it had of a funny taste.

yet again, we are spoiled with such a great spot so close to home. 

we have been coming here for 5 years now, and it never lets down. CC is the closest to the east coast style Chinese i grew up with in NJ here in phx, and everything we have tried is delicious! affordable, accomodating, only warninig is that the best stuff here is all fried- not the place to come on your well-behaved days. if you are ok with getting stuffed, grab some pot stickers, fried prawns and the salt-and-pepper pork, then go home and take a nap. grab a bowl of boiled wontons for later!

Very nice restaurant. Great customer service! The outside and inside are very nice and it is very clean. I ordered sesame beef and it was okay. I expected it to be crispy and sweet like sesame chicken, but it fell a little flat. I would definitely go back and try them again because this was only my first visit.

Best not to order the Sesame Chicken, it's unrecognizable and bland. Also they have a House Specialty Chicken that a staff member likened to General Tao's chicken~ it was terrible, we didn't even bring it home for the dogs. A friend recommended the chicken corn chowder, and while she seemed happy, no one else @ our table (of 8) liked it. The crab puffs sucked. And while I'm complaining they have no egg rolls on the menu, only spring, and they don't have crispy noodles. I didn't like their sweet & sour sauce either, too runny, dripping out of bottles, you couldn't get enough of it to stay on the food. We got the last parking space (upon our arrival @ 6:30pm) although there were only 6 seated tables. Naturally, waiting for someone to leave so you can park is less than ideal.

On the other hand they have wonderful potstickers, perfect potsticker sauce too. We were also VERY happy with the Mongolian Beef. They have a chicken dish called "pillows", I know it sounds strange, but It's good~ I spooned the potsticker sauce inside, yum.

I've been here 5-6 times over the years. I know it's got a decent reputation and always seems busy but I have never been highly impressed with the food. Nothing that bad, but I was never just delighted by my meal. The kung pao chicken I got tonight was at best average tasting and they gave a small portion of steamed rice. The vegetable egg roll was odd. They were sliced in half diagonally and very greasy. I have gotten better food from hole in the wall places. But you can do a lot worse than China Chili.

I hear that in China, people can be very pushy, even rude, by American standards, shouting across a dining room, ordering their servers around.

Don't worry, no such behavior will be necessary here. All the servers are speedy and attentive. Expect to order drinks within seconds of sitting down and food arrives faster than McDonald's. 

One of the cleanest and largest Asian restaurants I've seen. They have family sized tables with a huge turntable in the middle. 

Lunches are large enough to share and dinner is family style.

The shrimp dishes are particularly exceptional, large and always de-veined. Try the "prawns with vegetables" or "honey walnut prawns." 

Sizzling black pepper beef is great too.

Wanting to go to a Chinese restaurant that wasn't a buffet, I stopped by China Chili in Central Phoenix. The inside is a vast room filled with beautiful chandelier lighting and stunning Chinese artwork. Looked pretty fancy for the price, so it's a good choice to take someone special with the apperance you have money. I asked for a small table in the back corner to eat in peace among the sparse group of younger and older people present. 

Menu was quite large, with a deep selection of various choices. I was feeling seafood tonight, so I went with the Kung Pao Calamari which according to the menu is spicy and hot. Faster than I could say Toa chie, the dish arrived. No joke, the server walked into the kitchen and the food came out in about 2 minutes. That's insane and impressive. 

The Kung Pao Calamari in presentation was great and looked delicious on the oval plate. Red, green bell peppers, cucumbers, peanuts and of course the calamari. Scooped up some calamari with various bits of vegetables and upon first impression it was quite good, although the calamari was fairly rubbery more than what I'm used to. The chewing went on longer than I was hoping. Good nonetheless and acceptable. Portion of food was more than adequate with a side of rice as is customary. I did not sense any spiciness to the food which I found disappointing as I do love a little kick in my seafood. I'd honestly like to try something else next time I come here. I sense the potential here.

Overall, China Chili for the price and the atmosphere it's worth it. I would actually rate this place if I was able, close to 3 and half stars as the food wasn't as dynamic as the more upscale authentic places I've been to but then again I didn't expect that either. If you want Chinese food that has a little more class that doesn't kill your paycheck check out China Chili.

Yes Go to China Chili! 
I was tipped off by a friend to this place...a little bit out of my "hood" but what the hey. 
For starters they are good about QUALITY, Yeah I said it QUALITY. We could make wonton soup and let it get mushy and bland. China Chili's is very fresh tasting...lots of mildly crunchy cabbage...YUM! 
My husbands new love affair with Singapore Noodles was once again renewed. He ate almost the entire (giant) portion. 
I was intrigued by Pillow Chicken (where do you find this at other places?...you don't!). Chicken and water chestnuts wrapped in a light almost rice dough...with black pepper sauce. All the right combinations working together to make a great dish! 
Will we go back..YES! Now we just have to drive a bit further to great Chinese cuisine.

Really good house chow fun!  Meats were not dry!   Usually this level of Chinese food starts with cooked meats and just adds different sugary msg sauces.  While the chicken had been sitting,  it drys out.   Not this place.  
All my meats were juicy and tender.  $9 for a dinner size which was huge. My wife loves the chop suey, and she's picky.

What is the hubub over China Chili?!?! Don't understand the high rating this restaurant is getting?!?

I had not been back to this area for 5+ years and wanted to stay near downtown Phoenix where my friend lives. I looked up high-rated Chinese restaurants in downtown Phoenix and China Chili, of course, came out on top. Well folks, you yelpers here are totally fooled!

First of all when you sit down, the menu gives the impression that this restaurant is a Szechaun or Hunan restaurant. It's NOT! The chefs at this restaurant are Cantonese serving Szechaun and Hunan dishes.

For starters, my friend and I ordered Sizzling Rice Soup. As entrees, we ordered Szechaun Shrimp and Braised Tofu with Beef. I had a hint of what was to come by listening to the waitresses... Surprise! They all were speaking in Cantonese!

The Sizzling Rice Soup was very good. 

The Szechaun Shrimp turned out to be a Sweet and Sour dish...  Shocking! There are almost NO dishes in Szechaun cooking that are Sweet and Sour! It looked nice though, the shrimp was ringed around the plate by thin slices of cucumber. The Braised Tofu with Beef was almost as bad, chemically tenderized beef that probably is used from another dish and dropped in the Braised Tofu. Both dishes were supposed to be HOT... NOT!

The only redeeming thing we got out of this adventure was that our wallets were not affected that much by the experience!

Demographics of Customers @ 6pm - less than 5% Oriental, 40% of capacity.

If you want an authentic Szechaun restaurant, travel down to Tempe to Wong's Place on Baseline Road off of I-60. I will be going there tomorrow night and writing a review which will be more positive than this one!

Best orange chicken in phoenix--this place has a cult following and great service - green beans are amazing as well as the chow mein! Phoenix's options for great Chinese food in downtown/midtown are limited but China chili is great no matter the context
He a group of six, all we very happy. We all ordered different items and appetizers and had to bring home food. Portions are large and service was great.

This is an excellent restaurant with very tasty unique dishes. Why am I giving it 5 stars? 
My mom said that she really enjoyed her meal, and was the best Asian dinner she's ever had. 
I was glad to hear that because I liked my food too! 

Although this restaurant is called China Chili, it takes its inspiration from Singapore and Malaysian influences. 

The egg rolls were even different. I was pleased to see that they use rice wrapper instead of the thick flour kind that most Chinese restaurant use. I don't really like those because they are too thick! 

Also, being a vegetarian, I was also very impressed with the vegetable selection here. My roommate ordered the Ma Po Tofu. I ordered the Tofu with green string beans, and my mom ordered the cashew chicken. 

The dishes were prepared to a high standard and served in good-sized portions. 

The service here was quick and friendly, and the prices were very reasonable. Will be back again. :-)
If you're looking for real authentic Chinese food , you can't go wrong here!! From the Roast duck to the fried rice you can't go wrong !

I give China Chili 5 stars because it has some treats I can't find anywhere else. I've had quite a few things on their menu and I've only disliked one thing. My favorites include the steamed won-tons (very speesy spicy and sweet at the same time, so my man and I will literally battle if they give us an odd number. It gets bloody.), chicken corn chowder (introduced to me by the harbinger of good soups and even better taste, my dearly departed best friend Andre), mushroom and spinach soup (HUGE meaty mushroom chunks with tofu and spinach in a light chicken broth... it's light but flavorful), and my aforementioned sparring partner/boyfriend is crazy about the salt and pepper beef, which is a reasonable and edible facsimile of pepper spray when you get it made like he does. I can't even swallow the stuff, but he just powers it down like drano in a tub.

We very rarely eat there because the decor is just so tacky, but we love it so much, we ordered out for it on our anniversary. Be that a testament to its deliciousness or our stubbornness is your decision.
When here for lunch great food and very friendly staff :)...gave us free egg rolls,cheese wontons & a soda...I it's the small things that really count! Thanks for the great service and food!!!
Very delicious and affordable food! I will definitely recommend this place for everyone! Very fast service and fresh food! Nothing more to say.

i have to second deborah's sentiments that just because there are 4 stars doesn't mean it is awesome --- but it's all the things i think a chinese restaurant should be.
1. close to my apartment (ok that's bias but its important to me)
2. really fast. seriously i stopped in and gave them my order and it was ready in less than 15 minutes.
3. tastes good
4. afterwards you feel guilty because you're pretty sure it had 4 days worth of calories in it and its sitting like a rock in your stomach. and the oil is coming out of your pores.

this is what i expect from all chinese restaurants, and i am frankly disappointed when it's not there (pei wei for instance does not have this)... so for that reason, there are 4 stars. it's my local takeout chinese place, and i love it for it... but im pretty sure i'd never actually eat inside.

I ordered one of China Chili's more pedestrian lunch specials: The House Special Chicken.  It tasted...well, pedestrian.  Don't get me wrong, It was not nasty at all.  
I suppose compared to Pillow Chicken, this dish seems like its from a different restaurant altogether. Perhaps I should have cut my teeth on something a little less flamboyant than the Pillow Chicken when I first went here, because each dish I've tried after that has left me disappointed.  

However, keep in mind that I've been ordering off of the lunch special menu lately, and those dishes are usually a little less spectacular on anyone's menu.  But I guess that's no excuse, as anything you serve to your customers should be prepared to the utmost.  

Anyway, today's dish, House Special Chicken...  Its described as battered chicken in a spicy garlic sauce.  Its battered and spicy, but not very garlicy.  Still its decent.  A good taste, just not a very eventful taste.  Of note is how tender and delicious the chicken was.  I felt like taking it and putting in a sandwich.

Again, the soup of the day was the one that I cannot eat.  Don't know what this stuff is...but I guess somebody on this planet must like it.

Oh well, I can either hold this place in high regards related to the lone dinner entree I've tried and downgrade it for the few lackluster dishes I've had afterwards...or I can give them a break since most 'lunch combos' are only good enough to fill stomachs at the office and not to wow the tastebuds.  

Meh.  The stars remain.  I keep going back...so I guess its accurate to state that:  Yay, I am a fan indeed.
Great service, superb food! Definitely a place to take friends & family!  We came for lunch and are leaving with full tummies!

We tried China Chili for the first time this past Monday with my family, after hearing about it from friends and family for a long time.  The place did not disappoint.  It is clean, spacious, and nicer than some of the other Chinese food dives that we love to frequent.  The service was fast and attentive.  

We ordered the following: West Lake soup, honey walnut prawns, beef chow fun (dry), sesame chicken, mongolian beef, house fried rice, garlic green beans with tofu and Peking pork chop.  Our favorite restaurant is Hong Kong Dining on  24th St and Indian School, but China Chili has some dishes that surpass them.  The West Lake soup was good, not too thick with good flavor.  I thought the garlic green beans were top notch, as were the honey walnut prawns.  Those three dishes I would come back for any day.

The sesame chicken was ok -- it was sliced chicken with sesame sauce poured over it.  I prefer the more Americanized version where individual pieces of chicken are deep fried in a sesame sauce.  I would say the same of the Peking pork chop -- I prefer the dish made by Hong Kong Dining.  CC's seemed to have too much sauce that was maybe a little too sweet.  

All in all a gem of a Chinese restaurant that we will definitely frequent when we are on that side of town!

We stopped in on the 1st of July, around 6pm and it was a great first experience. The restaurant was super clean. The staff was very friendly and always quick with refills. I don't recall my glass ever getting halfway empty.

We order the Egg Rolls and Crab Cheese Puffs, for appetizers, the eggrolls were different a little small in size but very yummy. The Crab Ragoons were better, filled with cream cheese a little crab and green onion...gave them a good taste. 

For dinner we opted for the Honey Walnut Shrimp, Orange Chicken and Pillow Chicken. We were a little disappointed that we could only get white rice. To get fried rice we would have to order it as an entrée. The Honey Walnut Shrimp was really good, nice size Shrimp with tails removed.  The Orange Chicken was different than normal orange chicken - it reminded me of a buffalo chicken with a sweet kick to it. The Pillow Chicken was something I never had before and personally I did not like it. It reminded me of a crab cake or salmon patty...two things that I do not like; it is a texture issue not a taste issue. 

The staff was willing to box everything up with extra steamed rice. We even order a chicken fried rice and Mu Shu Beef to go, which proved to be very yummy leftovers.

I had heard so much about this being the best Chinese in town, so disappointed!!The people very nice friendly as can be. They get five star's it was the food. I got one of the lunch specials egg drop soup came with it, I added crab cheese puffs.  First there was NO crab in the crab cheese puffs, just cream cheese. (one of my biggest pet peeves when ordering this dish) The soup bowl was not even half full and the soup had no taste. My main entrée was o.k. nothing I would order again Its clear they have a loyal customer base. It may take another try, but for me that wont be anytime soon.
They can make the hot and sour soup with veggie broth, no chicken and no shrimp for vegetarians!!

I love that we live so close to CC, because our friends from all over the valley come to eat at CC! I have never ordered anything I don't like. The Szechuan Shrimp is my favorite and you can never go wrong with some hot Jasmine tea. Also, the food always comes out so fast and because it's such a large restaurant we never have to wait. To top it all off, the lunch specials are amazing!
This was very good Chinese food! I'm pretty picky and we really have enjoyed our meals here both times.

remember back in the '80's that Chinese restaurant in malls your dad would take the whole family while mom spent endless hours shopping? where the food was just bland unless you ordered fried battered shrimp drenched in sweet and sour sauce? this place is keeping those memories alive. 

ordered the spicy lover's prawns. not spicy and nothing to love. even the egg rolls were nothing more than fried dough with specks of cabbage thrown in. the prawns with seasonal veggies smelled fishy and was tasteless. 

everything on Yelp has four stars. we chose this place out of convenience. i'd rather make the drive to Scottsdale and eat decent Chinese food next time.

Best value for a spicy, tasty lunch. The servings are generous enough that I almost always have food to take home. Lunch comes with soup -- the good days are Monday and Thursday; that's when they have hot and sour soup. The other days is some kind of egg drop with corn (too bland for me). You also get a cute, little vegetarian egg roll.

In order of wonderfulness, try the Kung pao fish, Kung Pao shrimp, Mongolian beef, and Szechuan green beans. I've only ever tried the spicy stuff, so I can't comment on the other offerings.

The wait staff is ALWAYS friendly and amazingly efficient. 

The dinner menu is good, but the lunch is the best value.
The orange chicken is great. This place is always packed.

We went this past Saturday with my sister-in-law and her husband.  She works in the area and suggested we go to dinner here. 

I was extremely pleased with our meal.  We started with Egg Rolls, Pot Stickers and Boiled Won Tons.  The egg rolls were crispy and flavorful, the pot stickers were plump and the filling was delish, but the star for me was the boiled won tons.  I have never had anything like them, They were packed full of meat and served in this savory peanut flavored broth. My sister-in-law was a little wary of trying one, but she did and concurred that they were quite good.  She is not the most adventurous eater so that is really saying something!

For our main courses we  shared Mongolian Beef, Peking Shrimp, Salt and Pepper Shrimp, and Sichuan Beef.  The Mongolian Beef was tender and seasoned perfectly, The Peking Shrimp had a spicy red sauce the had a little tang to is and was served with snow peas (nice and crunchy not over cooked) and onions.  The salt and pepper shrimp were fried with a nice light batter that was salty but not over done and the jalapeno peppers were just right.  The Sichuan  Beef was my least favorite, I thought the sauce made the batter a little soggy but I really liked that sauce so was still a good dish.

The portions are huge, I was full after the appetizers as were my dinner companions, so we took a lot of our dinner home, and it tasted great the next day.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  I especially appreciated that she boxed up our leftovers instead of just dropping off some boxes at the table.

From the outside the restaurant doesn't really look like much, a sand colored stucco building, but inside it is furnished and decorated nicely, the tables are spaced  so that you don't feel crowded and the lighting was bright but not overly so.

My only complaint would be that their tofu dishes had meat in them so there weren't as many vegetarian options as I would have like to have seen.  I didn't get a chance to ask if they can adjust them for vegetarians, but will the next time I go and before I take any of my veggie buddies there.

First time in here, at lunch break. The place was busy and have line to wait for the table. The fun part is you even can share the table with stranger so you can make a new friend, I guess :).
The shrimp spicy was the delicious, the soup was great. The price is even better. I enjoyed everything here and would like to go back to try something else. 
Great place to eat lunch for sure.
Everything was superb.  Egg flour soup, pot stickers, orange chicken --all fantastic.  Great prompt service.

If you're looking for a more traditional Chinese experience for your pallet while in a traditional American setting with actual silverware look no further. Always yummy, it's one of my favorite Chinese places.

This place is the best! Start with the boiled wontons, so much flavor it's to die for. My favorite is the orange chicken, honey walnut prawns, and we love the Mongolian Chicken with string beans instead of onions!!! We have been going to China Chili for the longest time and NEVER EVER had any issues. 

The staff is super attentive and always friendly. The food is always hot and delicious. Sally, the owner is so nice and always comes over to greet us. 

China Chili has to be one of the top Chinese restaurants in Phoenix!!!

We enjoyed our dinner here. I saw a lot of good recommendations on Szechuan prawns , sauce was great, but it had too much of batter for my liking. BBQ park appetizer was tender, dumplings could have been pan fried for a little bit longer. We will be back to try other dishes. Oh yeah , service was great and fast.

We have been looking for a good Chinese restaurant in Phoenix for a long time. We had heard about this place but for whatever reason never tried it. Well we tried it today and YAY! We found a GREAT CHINESE RESTAURANT!!! We ordered the egg rolls-very good, Curried Chicken-super flavorful with tender chicken (NOT that weird chicken some places have). We ordered it mild knowing it can be pretty spicy. The Beef Chop Suey isn't on the menu but when my mom mentioned it they said WE CAN MAKE IT FOR YOU! The meat was super tender and the dish full of flavor. She said it's the best chop suey she's ever had. They are very happy to alter the meals to your liking. 

The restaurant is pretty. Tablecloths and chandeliers. Service is exceptional. We will definitely be regulars! Try it!!!

We always call in for take out and the order is always ready with in 10 minutes. Great, fresh and hot is the best way to describe this place. Over 4 years of coming here we have only been disappointed once. Not a bad record.

Yummy!!

It is expensive but they do serve a lot of food so it's worth it.

China Chili has delicious chow mein and crab puffs.

The parking is TERRIBLE, parking on the side of the building is easier if there are spaces but it's usually packed full of people and cars.

So yummy & so fast! House special chicken & orange chicken are my favorites. Plus they use all white chicken breasts. I love that "spicy" dishes can be ordered a little more mild; satisfies the entire lunch group dining together.

Stopped in for lunch, I was seated and order taken right away.  I was only given the lunch special menu, and they brought my soup (hot & sour) no kidding within  2 minutes of placing my order.  The soup was great, I was only half way through when my entrée arrived, I ordered sweet and sour chicken.  The serving was large, easily enough for 2 meals.  It was ok, nothing to get excited about but....what I didn't like is the pieces are huge, like a breast cut in 4 very long strands.  I could not get a knife, so it was hard to eat the chicken, it wasn't tough meat but it didn't cut well with a fork.  I didn't like my leftovers enough to take them with me.

They are really fast so if you're in a hurry at lunch it's worth I try.  I'll probably try them a couple more times and would like to view the full menu.  

If you dig hot and sour soup, you should definitely try theirs.  Nom!!!

We had the boiled wontons because another reviewer said they were so good and they were awesome!!  The Honey Walnuts Prawns were also AMAZING!! Chinese comfort food!! Very good place & highly recommended!!
This was good standard Chinese fare.  Great for large groups

I wouldnt say the best but certainly was good. The orange chicken is nothing short of amazing. Real chicken. Very fulfilling. Loud restaurant, lots of people. Id def come back and try other items! The cashew chicken wasnt my favorite.
I love going to China Chili for lunch because they are so fast! The food is delicious too!

I haven't been to China Chili in a few years and decided to go with a group of six. The food was decent, my only issue was the speed of the food and service. The speed of the food - was Extremely fast.  Why would that be an issue? We ordered 7 different dishes and from ordering to delivery was 5-7 minutes literally. The restaurant must precook the food and then when it's ordered, they throw some sauce on it and warm it up. For the service - we had to beg and stop the servers for water refills, more rice and getting the check. A water refill shouldn't take longer then preparing 7 dishes.
Have been eating here for years and really can't think of a single complaint! Food is always fresh and delicious and the staff is very attentive.

It's not that good, it's just convenient and well-known. At least it's exceptionally an quick option for takeaway. 

Orange chicken is usually a safe dish, but this one was just drowning in sauce. There is so much vinegar in this sauce, it bothered my eyes as I opened my styrofoam box. Oh my goodness, I am kind of impressed because I have never had that happen to me. There's really not much complexity, however. Just sugar, vinegar, green onions, and maybe orange as an afterthought. 

The veggie egg rolls that come with combos are tiny and some of the greasiest ever. 

The egg drop soup is totally bogus. 

As for my dining companion's meal, they were not a fan of the kung pao (?) shrimp. Loaded with veggies, it looked a bit more appetizing. But it was loaded with salt, as well as what I believe to be chicken broth, which is a strange choice. 

Look, it's not like this place is a disaster. I'd eat it again...if someone else were buying. I don't really feel like coming back.

This place is addicting, I've been coming here for years and I can count 2 times that the food hasn't been up to par, other than that, it's always fresh, fast and great tasting.

Their prices did increase when the move occurred but I think most people expected it, their previous location was bursting at the seams.

Woohoo Chinese food!  Found out about this place from neighbors.  It's close enough to walk from my new condo.  Great service.  Once you step inside you get the feeling that you are in San Francisco for Chinese dining.  We loved the walnut fried prawns and the chicken curry!  This will be my new go-to place for Chinese food (dine in and take out).  China Chili, I'm glad you're nearby.

My husband grew up eating at this restaurant since he was young. From the staff to the food, there is nothing to complain about. We love so many different dishes here, but if we have to narrow it down to 3 it is... extra spicy orange chicken, salt and pepper calamari, and the Szechwan shrimp.

The orange chicken is whole chicken breast that is breaded instead of little nuggets. You get more chicken than a ton of breading. The orange sauce is amazing, especially with some spice.

The salt and pepper calamari.. may not seem all that exciting or exotic, but it is delicious! I love the favors the green onions and jalapeño with the salt and pepper. 

Our newest favorite dish is the Szechwan shrimp. It is different from what I had growing up. I don't like szechwan anything, so I would have never given this dish a second glance. Of course one day, my friend ordered it and I just about died! I know I am pretty optimistic with my reviews, but I mean it, this dish is delicious and weirdly refreshing. It has undertones of cilantro and it comes with cucumbers!

Yeah not so bad Chinese food, big portions, family style.  The service, does not go out of their way but does their job very well.  
This would be a classic 3 and a half stars.  
I like plates that come out sizzling from the heat.  This is a nice place to have a larger group sit down and eat family style.

Look for their sign off 3rd st.

We have been searching for a great Chinese restaurant in the Phoenix area for 14 years, After reading so many great reviews I thought this would be it. Sadly, it isn't.. We had such high expectations but I give this a C+ at best. We ordered takeout. When we got home, the Salt & Pepper Chicken we ordered turned out to be very chewy Salt & Pepper Calamari. Our Orange Chicken had very little heat and although it was listed as lightly battered and fried ours had no batter on it at all and appeared to have been sauted instead. The fried rice was decent as was the Pork Egg Fu Yung but nothing to get excited about. So the search continues.

Incredibly fast lunch time service, and you get a pretty complete meal for the price. I have really enjoyed everything I've ordered from here. Entrées are dominated by rich and flavorful spices. Rather than overloading you with heat, they manage to have sauces that are tangy, sweet, and spicy simultaneously.

We have only recently become a regular at China Chili! The food is fresh and beautifully served. I am a big fan of won ton soup and theirs can't be beat. The prices are good and the service is quite pleasant. This has got to be a stop if you are in the mood for any kind of Chinese food as the menu is quite extensive.

One of my favorite spots for affordable and tasty Asian lunches is the China Chile Restaurant (302 East Flower Street, Phoenix, AZ 85012). The Lunch Specials Menu offers a variety of mild and spicy dishes reasonably priced. I prefer the spicy dishes that are characterized by the restaurant's namesake. My normal selections are the "Spicy" Kung Pao Shrimp or Kung Pao Chicken which come with an egg roll, steamed Jasmine white rice and a complimentary cup of the Soup of the Day. I am always amazed by the efficiency of the restaurant staff. The meals are served fresh and at lightning speed. I highly recommend this eatery if you are looking for a quick and delicious meal!

Took my daughters here, so the adventures were already going to be limited.
Ordered the pot stickers, which were delicious.

We ordered beef, chicken, and pork chow mein, and shared it amongst us.

The dishes were large, and delicious.

The spicy relish they provide on the table is amazing.

I have been wanting to go here, and I'm glad I did. I will probably be back.

Perfect for a Quick lunch. And I mean seriously quick. Like ninja light speed fast. 

Under two minutes consistently from order to table. How can you beat that! One time they clock-in at 1min 45sec for a table of five. 

My favorites are the House Special Chicken, the Orange chicken and the Prawns. can't go wrong and you will leave stuffed and satisfied.
everything was fresh and super good, def coming here again when i'm in Phoenix!!

This place is great. The seating is just a bunch of tables in a big room. The food is fantastic! You should go as a group and share dishes, as the portions are quite large.  The service is great and it's a nice place to share conversation and good eats with friends.

By far the closest I can get to China Town here in AZ!!!

I have eaten in numerous Chinese restaurants including buffets here in AZ and by far this is the best one I have tried.

The BBQ pork with veggies, house chow ming, Thai noodles, snow pea beef, Peking duck etc.. All are great.

They have always since day one of me and my family eating here, have given us excellent customer service and served us with a smile.

I recommend this restaurant to anyone felling nostalgic from being far from China Town in LA or San Fran! 

Try it you won't be disappointed.

The orange chicken is very popular with my coworkers. In fact, some would eat there everyday if they could. I think their food is mediocre at best although they give very large portions and their service is very, very fast.

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink):
1 star:  Never again.
2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back.
3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad.
4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return.
5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.

This review is more like 3.5 stars.  It's also going to be way more effusive in its praise than the 3.5 stars it deserves.

If I'm to be completely and totally honest with myself, this is a good but average Chinese restaurant.  Or rather, Chinese-American restaurant, as the vast majority of the dishes are not traditionally Chinese but more Chinese-American (think sweet and sour whatever, Mongolian beef, etc.)  Also, I can only speak to the lunchtime experience as I've only been here for lunch.

Despite all this mediocrity, I LOVE this place.  Not sure why.  I order the house special chicken almost every time I come.  A fried chicken cutlet, sliced, covered in a slightly spicy brown sauce.  Served with rice and a small spring roll.  A small bowl of soup also comes with every lunch.  Maybe its because the soup is on your table within 5  minutes.  Maybe it's because you have your food 3 minutes after finishing your soup.  Maybe it's because fried chicken in brown sauce is pretty tasty.  Again, I love this place for its 80's Chinese restaurant kitsch, speedy service, and tasty food.  

I can barely think of a cheesier Chinese joint to love.

Service was SO fast which is great for a working lunch, but I've had better egg drop soup. My friend, who doesn't like eggs at all, was not offered a different option for the egg drop soup. Otherwise, the meal was great. Everything else tastes delicious. I've heard this place is pretty busy, but the day I went it luckily wasn't very packed and we were able to get in and out in no time.

Great Food very tasty and some unique dishes I'd never seen before like Pillow Chicken!  Large portions and nice presentation on plate.  Open cafeteria style dining room.  Prompt waitresses and waiters...

Wow, that was good Chinese food.  I went at lunch and the place was packed and took about ten minutes to get a table.  The prices were a bit high but you get a ton of food.  Service was good... the staff are all Asian, they want to get you in and out fast which is great...  I'll be back

Chinese food is one of those things for me... once I find a place I love, I stick with it!

That was the story for my last Chinese Restaurant until they abruptly closed one day without notice...yes I am bitter.  The restaurant I am referring to was a little place called "Silver Dragon" south of Dunlap on 19th Ave.  It was the Cheers of Chinese... I walked in and everybody knew me, and immediatley started to make my meal (they would double or triple it, if I had company).  My favorite dish, was called Singapore Rice Noodle.... obviously a rice noodle dish that included stir fried spare ribs, chicken, shrimp, green and yellow onions tossed with a non-spicy curry sauce.

When they closed, I was in a state of depression for nearly two years!!  Until last night, when I happened upon China Chili, not my first visit, but my first SIT DOWN experience with the restuarant.  I do what I have done at every chinese restaurant since Silver Dragon... I opened the menu and went directly to the noodle dishes to see if they offered "Singapore Rice Noodle".  Much to the delight of my stomach, they did and it was EXACTLY the same as I remember it at Silver Dragon.

I am already conspiring to have it again today for lunch!!!!  Oh... they have the fastest service here too, not more than five minutes after we ordered appetizers were already coming out!

This place was delicious before the light-rail pushed it back to 3rd St., and it's still the best Chinese take-out in my area.  I've been about 10-15 times in the past year, and haven't been disappointed yet.  My guaranteed winners:

* Spicy eggplant
* Boiled wontons (in peanut sauce)
* Mongolian beef
* Sliced pork
* Hot and Sour Soup
* Crab puffs
* Green beans with sliced pork

I'm sure there's more--the menu's pretty sizable.  Takeout ready in 10-15 minutes is another big plus, and the dining room is clean and comfortable if you choose to eat there.

China Chili serves up good food, better than PF Changes and less expensive.  I have been there several times and the food and service have always been consistent.   Some Yelpers have complained about the interior, and while I agree that it is not the "Starbucks corporate America standard", I think it is very nice for a semi-authentic Chinese food joint, a much better décor than that of Gourmet House of Hong Kong, which offers up better and more authentic Chinese food in a less than appetizing atmosphere.   (GHHK used to be painted pepto pink, but I think they have upgraded to sea foam green).

I really like the sizzling rice soup, it's a nice change from the standards, but the wonton soup is good, and the hot and sour soup is average.  The shrimp/prawn and chicken dishes are tasty, but have been Americanized.  The live seafood options and duck are much more authentic.

Saw the restaurant on Check, Please and decided to hit it for lunch on Friday.  Arrived around 1:00 - still quite a few lunch-goers there but we were seated promptly.  They are geared to get your lunch to you so if you have to get back to work, it won't be their fault if you're late!  While we were still looking at the lunch special menus the server brought us the soup of the day - egg drop with lots of corn in it.  Very tasty.  Wife ordered Mongolian Beef and I ordered House Special Chicken.  Drinks were brought quickly and by the time we were finishing the soup our entrees arrived.  Great lunch servings - large plate filled with entree, rice, and vegetable egg roll.  The egg roll was the only thing about the lunch that I didn't like.  It is one of those very thin fried rolls that I eat by imagining that it's a fried won ton.  But the entrees and rice were excellent and a great value for less than $8.  Will definitely be back for dinner.

The lunchtime service here is so fast they either use cooking ninjas or a microwave. No human can cook this fast.  Maybe the servers read your mind?

Consistent, hot and cheap.  A Phoenix staple... Probably why I see Jerry Colangelo here all the time.
awful, food was not good, people with me got sick and will not go there again.

Negatives first:
The shrimp were not properly deveined. I'm not sure if this is the norm since was my 1st visit.

Positives:
Food - Very flavorful American Chinese. In fact, probably the most flavorful I've had in years. The menu isn't typical either. There are some awesome menu choices.

Parking - Plentiful. There is parking all around the building. And it's needed, the restaurant was super busy this Friday night.

Price - Excellent price points. You get plenty of food without breaking the bank.

I ordered a carry out of the house chicken and the house fried rice. I paid $20.  The portions were large. We had enough for two and have plenty left over.
The sauce on the chicken is yummy goodness. That thing was made with love! It's garlicky without the strong aftertaste. The chicken was fresh and tender. It was well sauced yet the batter was still crispy.
The house fried rice is very good. The rice, cooked well. It is served with chicken, shrimp and beef.

I usually enjoy quaint romantic restaurants, so I don't know if I'd ever dine in. The dining room and kitchen are pretty wide open and bright. No where to have a quiet convo.

China Chili is added to my list of favs while here in Phoenix.

I've been coming to this restaurant for at least 15 years, dating back to its previous location. There are so many good dishes. But there are also some items that are more American dishes that are okay/good, but I wouldn't recommend you ordering them since there are a lot of way better dishes.

So. I'm just going to list my all time favorite dishes :) 
Peking duck. Salad, chicken not fried. Salt and pepper pork chops (but the shrimp and calamari are also good). Spicy prawns. Seafood soup. Beef chow fun. Honey walnut prawns. Boiled wontons (and you can add noodles and make it a meal!). Orange chicken (or beef. It's fried. Who fries beef?! But it's delicious!). Szechwan green beans. 

Please remember you can pretty much customize your order to what you want. If you don't want it fried, just ask. If you don't want MSG (which is in some dishes apparently), just ask. If you want it less or more spicy, just ask. No meat?  Just ask. They try their best to accommodate their customers.

Love this restaurant- great food - amazing service. Duck is wonderful. Kung Pao Fish is terrific. Have never had a bad dish. We dine here regularly always consistent. Hot n sour soup is the best in town.

Pretty good Chinese food, satisfied my orange chicken craving. Got a to go so I don't have any comments on the service. Got orange chicken, rice and a pork appetizer (forgot what it's called). All of it was hot and tasted fresh. Not your typical orange chicken- this was slices of chicken with the orange sauce but it was pretty dang spicy for me. But I'm also a spice wuss, so it could be average spice. We def will be back to try more things on the menu.

Second visit and it was ON POINT, again!  The food is good, hot and DELICIOUS!  Veggie spring rolls-EXCELLENT! Mongolian chicken-EXCELLENT! The egg drop soup-EXCELLENT!  In the neighborhood-EXCELLENT!

Hooray for the reopening of China Chili!  The new location seems to be much larger than the old one and has way more parking (two lots!).  The decor of the giant dining room is still pretty plain and the music was an odd selection varying between traditional Asian music and Kenny G.  

Ambiance aside, I thoroughly enjoyed my favorite dish, Sweet and Sour Chicken.  It was a radiant shade of orange and simply delicious, as always.  I especially appreciate the fact that they give you a larger portion of your dish than of white rice, a proportion skewed at some other Asian restaurants.  I could have gone for a knife to cut up the giant pieces of chicken that make up the dish, but I powered through. 

I'm generally pretty picky about my Chinese food, but China Chili hasn't yet let me down.

Wanted to branch out and try something new after an appt today. SO GLAD WE CHOSE HERE!!!! The food was not only delicious but we were served in less than 5 minutes. Tip and all out the door with satisfied tummys for less than $20. Needless to say we will def be back!!! If lunch was that great I can only imagine what dinner will be!!! Yummmm!!!!
This place is pretty good.  It's what you should expect for above-average chinese food in Arizona.  I've been twice, and it was good both times.  I'll be back.
Excellent food here recommend this place to any first timers looking for a change. Next time I'm back in town I will try this place again

I've been hunting for a place like this since I moved to Phoenix in 98'.  My wife and I ate here for lunch a couple of weeks ago.  Nothing fancy on the inside or outside but the service and the food are great.  My wife and I shared a plate of the Orange Chicken and a plate of the Mongolian Beef.  They were both great!  Within a minute of ordering, we had the egg drop soup in front of us.  It wasn't the best I've ever had, but above average.  You can't get better service either.  Looking forward to going back!

I just pulled into the parking lot and felt compelled to write this review before I went inside. China Chili is on my "top 5 favorite places to eat" list. The food is SO good and it's out unbelievably fast. Everyone that works here works together to get you what you need and they're all very friendly. I'm here AT LEAST once or twice a month (for the last 6 years). I'm not sure if that's something to brag about, but I'm just being honest. ;) You should eat here! #saltandpepperchicken #beefandbroccoli

This place is delicious. The Orange chicken is awesome, not all breaded up. Order it spicy, it's perfect. Also, get the boiled wontons trust me. And the size versus the price is great. $10 should fill you up easy during lunch. I drive from Happy Valley Rd to go eat here.

Went in for lunch the other day and had the Mongolian Beef, House Chow Mein and Boiled Won Ton. All of them were very good and the service was ridiculously quick with refills, etc. Would like to go back and try some of the other dishes.

Although the view from the street, the front of the building and the decor not too appealing the food by far made me forget easily how the old building looked. Lemon chicken is my new favorite.  Fresh, light breading and NO heavy sugary syrup, actual light and thin sauce.

This is a Phoenix institution and like most such long-lived restaurants it is safe but lacking in edginess. The food is properly prepared and served, but there is little spice to be found. Sauces are mild if slightly oversalted for my taste. The busy but congenial atmosphere works better for lunch than dinner. One positive indicator is the number of Chinese folks who eat here. I certainly would return when it was convenient.
Love this place. Quick for lunch, food is consistent, and very affordable. Friday's are the best because they have the corn showder soup.
The best Chinese food y loved this place everything is good here and good prices in the tow

Some months ago, my boyfriend took me out for dinner at China Chili and I've been hooked ever since! The food is fabulous! The portions are excellent and I've yet to have something I didn't like. My favorite is the Orange Chicken and the Hot & Sour Soup. These two items have become a staple in our diet. I'm also all about those cream cheese crab puffs, shrimp lo-mein, and the house fried rice.

I've turned several people onto this place and everyone tells me the same thing: OMG! THIS IS THE BEST CHINESE FOOD EVER!!!

If you are looking for a good meal with excellent portion sizes, China Chili is worth the extra $$. Give it a go! You won't be sorry!

This is one of my favorite places for lunch. I love the food. If you are on a quick lunch break, you will love the quick turn around. Generally, the time between order and plate averages 5-7 minutes. 

The Chicken with vegetables and brown rice was absolutely delicious. However, I saw those irresistible prawns on my husband's plate and oh my God, they melted in my mouth. BTW, the egg flower and hot and sour soups are great.

China Chili doesn't sound like much, and frankly it doesn't look like much either. But then when I opened the door from the 3rd Street side I was struck with the loud noise of a full house of hungry and happy eaters. So far I've only had the spicy Sichuan prawns, and it delivered. It was a hot, spicy and a wonderful blend of spices including garlic and chilies. Most of the items on the lunch menu were labeled 'spicy', and so hopefully the others are this good too. By the look of the other diners, the smiles seemed to indicate good stuff. The service was efficient and fast, too. Highly recommended.

The food here is better than run-of-the-mill Chinese/Asian, but what really sets it apart is the speed of service.  My friends and I laugh that the staff is almost clairvoyant, because your food will arrive just about the second you finish ordering it.  I particularly like the Orange Chicken, because the sauce and the breading seem very home-made, not processed.   The only downside to its popularity and speed of service is there can be a wait for seating during the lunch hour.

It was ok, but not great. I thought the prices were ok and you do get a lot of food. The service is ridiculously fast...from order to food on the table could not have been 5 minutes.  Would go again but not my first choice.

Tried this place for the first time as it came recommended to me online. A brief look at the menu and the name China Chili piqued my interest as it may be a Chinese eatery with an emphasis on spice. I'm a full blown Chili addict and a fiend for spicy dishes so I figured I'd give it a shot. 

 Place was nice and clean, had a very well established vibe, and quite a few locals and staff were eating when I popped in. I tried two dishes and had the egg rolls as an opener. None of what I ordered was spicy, even though the menu *indicated that they were. This is not something that I fault them for, since anymore it seems like no one in the valley is actually from here. All snowbirds and transplants from middle American-wherever, who likely piss and pad about their food being "too spicy". Perhaps I should have emphasized to make the dishes extra spicy. I've had this experience in the past with what are now some of my favorite places, and had to tell them YES I am absolutely sure I want it extra spicy, or Thai hot or whatever. Next time, I'll be sure to ask. 

 With that being said, while the dishes weren't spiced to my liking, they were absolutely fresh and very delicious and a healthy dose of chili sauce made up for it. House special chicken was fantastic and a definite highlight. Thinly sliced white meat chicken, with a crisp outer layer and a savory brown sauce. Would definitely order again. The food was delicious and the staff was great. When I'm in the midtown central area in the future, I'll be sure to stop in again.

Wow, so this is the mecca of Chinese food in Phoenix? I mean don't get me wrong, I had some enjoyable items, but this is the Macayo's of Chinese restaurants. Undaring dishes with expected flavors delivered witha reasonable price. Now, mind you there is a hell-a-handsome tattooed waiter, who while I'm waiting for my to go food, I do the blue steel, eye lash flicker while I'm puckering up my lips look. While I'm sure I think I look hot and flirty, he and the rest of the staff are hurling up the mid afternoon dim sum. I'm just saying so often the famous favorite that's been around forever can be stale and uninventive. But on a Sunday, the pork lo mein, crab puffs and broccoli and beef nicely soak up the cosmo overdose I suffered at the hands of the previous night bartender who overserved me. The nerve. Chow Mein yelpers!

Some friends of ours brought us to this place a few days ago.  The food was amazing.  We ordered the Phoenix platter for four people, which gave a salad, appetizer, soup, and about four or five different meals....all of which, awesome.  The food was delicious and fast.  The prawn rolls were my favorite.  Looking forward to going back and trying other things.  My friends who brought us here told us that they have tried nearly everything on the menu and haven't had anything bad there....it's all been great.
You want great chinese food with good prices and service this place is the real deal!! Came here last night everything was on point from the food to service to prices would definetly recommend

After failing miserably in Scottsdale trying to get decent Chinese food two days ago, I drove 30 minutes to China Chili last night.  I ordered the same dishes that I had two days ago (stir-fried noodles and dumplings) because I seriously wanted to compare the food.  

My reaction: It was pretty good.  

In comparison to the food from couple of days ago, this could have been labelled as being great.  

However, considering that I spent my teenage years working at an awesome Chinese restaurant to pay for my SUV that I rolled off the interstate, I cannot say that this was the best Chinese food that I have ever had.   I'm also a bit of a snob when the dish contains any type of noodles. The noodles I got yesterday were too overcooked and drowned in oil.  It had a good balance of flavor, but again, I don't want to be drinking vegetable oil by spoonfuls either, you know?  The meat and the seafood were in good size and cooked well, so kudos for that.  

I would go back to try some different dishes, but the overall content of the menu seemed quite general to me.   I'm still on the hunt for the best semi-Americanized-Chinese restaurant in the valley yet again this week.

Went on Tuesday with a few people from work. 3 out of the 4 people that went were out with food poisoning having the worst nights of their life. Somewhere between the Sweet & Sour Pork and Lemon Chicken only I remained safe with some decent Sweet & Sour Chicken.
Absolutely love this place. This is our goto place for bdays and friends and co workers lunch and dinners. Good food at a great price. Quick service for lunch when you only have 30mins.

I'm not surprised to see the wide variance in the ratings for China Chili, to be fair they tend to be incomsistent. It has been a staple for us going back 15 years to their location on Central. We have visitors from SF, Vancouver, NY, LA who are consistently amazed to find Chinese food of this quality in Phoenix. Even if they are the best of Phoenix on a good day, they are not rivals for the 5 stars in those towns though. 
Here's a few tips for getting the most out of China Chile. Don't do take out. Always get a soup, hot n sour is our favorite. Chicken Salad is special. They never miss on spring rolls and pot stickers. Honey walnut prawns get my luv one Jonesing to go there. Orange chicken and orange beef have not disappointed. Noodles have. Chow fun or chow mein should be on your order. They do shell fish superbly, especially scallops. Whole fish is a mixed bag some great, some not so. The pork chops and chashu are a bit dry for my taste. Special menus on the whole have been disappointing. It's boom or bust, but if they offer seared beef tenderloin take the risk. One night I'm raving to fiends about how good it is, at the same time a guy at an adjacent table is complaining to the manager about the very same dish. That's China Chile.
Always great. Always friendly. The four musts: honey walnut prawns, pillow tofu, orange chicken and hot and sour soup. Four of us last night got to have them all- best meal in Phoenix.

I dont like to give bad reviews but the food was bland from the soup of the day, to the House Special chicken to the Kung Pao chicken.   Watered down sauce. Kung Pao had literally 7 peanuts, meat cuts were chewey,  loaded with too much water chestnuts.  They should of named it Water chestnut chicken.
I hope others have a better experience and the recipes improved.  Unfortunately I can not recommend this restaurant.

To each their own. Maybe cause I grew up in NY? We love Chinese food. And I was hoping this would finally be the place. Honestly in my personal experience I'm not that impressed. Gets 1 star for ambiance, 1 more star because it's an actual restaurant with servers. And the third star is for their menu of choices and some of the items we ordered were pretty good. But why not 4 or even 5 stars... Well..I ordered their house chicken with fried rice. Looked great but no flavor. My daughter ordered Orange chicken, looked exactly the same as my dish but the sauce had a hint of orange..which was not bad but not impressed. Mom had Mongolian beef..tasty but nothing to scream off the top of a mountain. Which is what I was hoping for...from at least one dish. On the other hand their pot stickers was the only and one thing I would go back for, handmade, hearty and flavorful.
Also, the server highly recommended the salt and pork dish for us to take home to my Dad...let's just say it went back in the box and has been in the fridge for a while..sorry.

The quickest lunch in town.  We timed it.... 4 minutes from ordering to it arriving.  Not sure if this is good or bad in some people's eyes but good when you are lunching on a work day and need to get back to the office.  The lunch special prices are phenomenal -- I always get the mongolian beef, it's huge and delicious.  You get soup, your meal, rice and an egg roll. All for under 10 bucks (with a drink) and maybe even tax. 

I love China Chili, something about the colorful disco balls in the giant dining area and the curtness of everyone-- it makes me love it even more.

They do takeout too and it's excellent as well!

Excellent service, you are always greeted at the door and never have to ask to a refill. Great Chinese food in general, comes out quick for those in a hurry. Also, I am more willing to drive across town just for their boiled wonton spicy peanut soup - phenomenal

Wonderful quality food. They have a delicious WonTon Peanut Soup Appetizer that we frequently enjoy. Huge giant shrimp here that is also great. Their Kung Pao is also wonderful.

Very good service and the atmosphere is very nice. Recommend them without reservation. (No pun intended!)
My favorite is the orange chicken! It's quick & inexpensive... with a far higher quality then you might expect judging from the price!

I went here with my dad today for lunch at his suggestion. We got here around 11:45 and this place was hopping! We were sat right away and the very efficient servers came and gave us soup straight away. It was egg drop with chicken, which isn't my favorite, but it was ok. We decided to order some potstickers and an order of Hong Kong style noodles with chicken. It took five minutes for them to bring out the food... wow. The potstickers were really good, and the potsticker sauce was a nice balance of savory and sweet. The noodles were also very good. They were crispy, just like I like them. All of the veggies tasted really good, I could taste each veggies' individual flavor. It had snow peas, broccoli, carrots, and celery. It was all really great. So why four stars? I didn't really like the soup so much, I think it is so lame that restaurants give egg drop soup (In my opinion, it is the worst, and what about people with egg allergies?), and also the sauce on the noodles could have been more flavorful. Overall though, this place was really good, and I wouldn't mind going back here again.

Fastest sit down lunch in Phoenix! 

Lunch is always delicious, dinner is great as well!

Service is very efficient.

I'm stuck on the house chicken and the green beans.

We met a fri me here for dinner the other night 
Wow !! I'm very impressed !

Service was excellent and the food was awesome 
Large portions 

A great value !

If in the area again we would for sure stop in here again...

China Chili is my local go-to Chinese lunch special by work place. The lunch specials are very reasonably priced and they give you huge portions and extras like comped soup and a spring roll. The service is efficient and incredibly fast. The food itself is decent- nothing to get super excited about but good enough to fill you up without being super disappointing. It is best to come here for lunch rather than dinner because they do so much volume at lunch that the food is always freshly made by the time it gets to your table.
House fried rice is really good I haven't sat down to eat there I always order to go. Everything is always neat and clean and the employee are nice. It's a very quit atmosphere.
They have yummy egg drop soup and jasmine tea. I tried their teriyaki chicken and was disappointed in the sauce :/

It wasn't until going into Frances, the other day, that my husband and I were stopped in our tracks with an amazing smell wafting from The Prime nearby. You know it has to smell good when it is after lunch and he is trying to talk me into stopping in for a "small bite." Yeah right! Well, when we looked at their menu last night, it wasn't cutting our tastes and decided to go for China Chili instead.  I've tried this place before and it was so-so but I believe in second chances. Thank goodness for second chances. We ordered this curry rice noodle dish mixed with chicken and shrimp. That was my favorite part and reminded of the Hamun noodle dish we used to get at the now-defunct Big Wong's. The dish was $9 and was enough for 3 adults. We also had the BBQ beef app ($5) and the egg rolls ($2). I wasn't too much a fan of the egg rolls but everything else was great in my book. Total with a couple bucks tip was $20. I wonder how soon I can talk the husband into going back. Maybe right after our next lunch for a mid-afternoon snack...

To find out how the culinary skill of any Chinese chef, Ma Po Tofu would be the dish to order because this dish required the knowledge of how to mix the sauce properly.  Sadly, it was a disappointment from two angles:  1) The sauce had too much vinegar to it so it was very tart , 2) the vegetable that came with it was store bought carrots (Ding Ma-square diced) and peas which tells me they didn't invest much preparation on this dish at all and it was served without minced pork which is the absolute essential to this dish.  The restaurant didn't have any Asian patrons which was a bad sign.  In order to have an ethnic restaurant that earn the gold seal of approval, their own community have to support it which this place lacked.   This place may be busy but it isn't my cup of tea just like the way Chinese screw the British and offer them the worst tea (Black TEA) and charge them the most money so if you wanted American style Chinese food, this will be the place to go.

I got the spicy orange chicken here.  Granted being from SF I've become such a snob for what constitutes as good Chinese food.  However, I stepped into this restaurant recently and got myself a delicious meal with my coworkers.  I was really impressed with its authenticity and I'm glad there is a place like this near my work.  Especially with a good lunch special deal.

Hands down, the best place for a quick, affordable meal. The staff are prompt, the restaurant is very clean and I have never been disappointed with my experience. If you're looking for a great place for lunch - you've found it here.

Went here for a lunch date....both impressed. I had the orange chicken, J-Luv had the lemon chicken. I liked his better though....and luckily he learned well in kinder that sharing is caring! Keeper, right? Loved it! Big lunch sizes, and they come with egg rolls and soup. Going back and it is in my neighborhood! :)

China Chili is great when you want good food FAST.  I don't know how they get their food out so quickly, but it's pretty awesome - especially when you only have an hour lunch break.  I came here for lunch with my co-workers during the lunch rush and we all got our food within ten minutes of ordering.  I also came and ordered to-go after work one day and my food was also ready within ten minutes.

On top of being fast, the quality is there too.  I ordered the seafood blossom soup and it had nice chunks of shrimp and scallop in it and wasn't just all broth.  I also ordered the mapo tofu, which I really liked.  I can't say that its truly "authentic" Chinese food, but it's really tasty and I'll definitely be back!
Tried this place very skeptically, turns out to be good. Food is priced well, tastes good and service great!

I went here for my friend's graduation dinner.  We were served the traditional and authentic 10-course banquet-style dinner.  I didn't even know this place existed until that night!  The food is pure Hong Kong style cooking without the unnecessary frills --- just the way I like it!  The food comes hot and fresh and the wait stuff is friendly.  I can't remember every single dish that was served as it was an extremely festive night with lots of loud talking and cheers but I do recall the roasted duck and steamed fish in soy sauce with ginger and onions being amongst my favorite.  

Come for the delicious food and not the atmosphere because this place isn't that cute.  ;D

I consider this place to be one of Phoenix's hidden gems! The service here is always great and fast! I am a creature of habit when it comes to this place. I always get the house chow fun and hot and sour soup, both are amazing!

I have also been here a couple times for lunch. The dishes are great for lunch portions. Definitely check out this place if you haven't before!
Very fast service. Servers are so nice. It seems like a clean place. The food is at a decent price and great.

This place is pretty darn good! The portion sizes are decent so it's really easy to share as well. We tried the shrimp app and some crab angels. Pretty typical for these.
